commit_message:
Use global_physnet_mtu config in newton templates

The Newton neutron.conf template was missing the snippet to
support configuration of the underlying physical network MTU.

Add this snippet based on the Mitaka template, and tweak the
Mitaka template to insert the snippet prior to the zeromq
section config.

Change-Id: If38c2e056df8215d717bd29b46ff2fa0d0c6024d
Closes-Bug: 1673161
(cherry picked from commit 4a99be6bf68675179c392f04c7f2ea2e650c497e)

commit_message:
Use global_physnet_mtu config in newton templates

The Newton neutron.conf template was missing the snippet to
support configuration of the underlying physical network MTU.

Add this snippet based on the Mitaka template, and tweak the
Mitaka template to insert the snippet prior to the zeromq
section config.

Change-Id: If38c2e056df8215d717bd29b46ff2fa0d0c6024d
Closes-Bug: 1673161

commit_message:
Revert "Adjust MTU to compensate for VLAN tag issue"

This reverts commit 4223b88b708e145c1dcdc38e4209ecc9029dd91f.

The underlying neutron bug with native ofctl interface was fixed in Newton.
We no longer need to dumb down deployment MTU to accommodate Neutron.

Related-Bug: #1622017
Related-Bug: #1621533

Change-Id: I9082c2d198a02ac3321488df67a66d336556d64c
(cherry picked from commit c54d323ac3c3a6f8fecfedf71d6d0446a2599e8c)

subject: Make ServiceNetMap support custom network names
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-19 17:32:16.000000000', 'files': ['network/service_net_map.j2.yaml'], 'message': 'Make ServiceNetMap support custom network names

The rework to support custom roles moved the service net map
into a nested stack, but the logic it contains fails to consider
operators may override the network names via *NetName parameters.

So add a map_replace of the ServiceNetMapDefaults so we maintain
the existing default service->network assignments, even when the
network name is changed.

Note that operators will still be expected to pass any ServiceNetMap
overrides with the "new" network name, e.g whatever *NetName specifies,
otherwise I think environment files could get very confusing.

Change-Id: I52018e19428e11d26650f0ea6ccee3ae02494ff8
Partial-Bug: #1651541
'}]
commit_message:
Make ServiceNetMap support custom network names

The rework to support custom roles moved the service net map
into a nested stack, but the logic it contains fails to consider
operators may override the network names via *NetName parameters.

So add a map_replace of the ServiceNetMapDefaults so we maintain
the existing default service->network assignments, even when the
network name is changed.

Note that operators will still be expected to pass any ServiceNetMap
overrides with the "new" network name, e.g whatever *NetName specifies,
otherwise I think environment files could get very confusing.

Change-Id: I52018e19428e11d26650f0ea6ccee3ae02494ff8
Partial-Bug: #1651541

commit_message:
Change the way to distinguish the port type

In delete_port_postcommit, a DVR port (port['device_owner'] =
DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT) can match on l2pop_db.HA_ROUTER_PORTS[1],
but can not get any fdb entries by _get_ha_port_agents_fdb. Then,
the fdb_entries[network_id]['ports'] is been overwritten by {}. So
the associated flow entries will not be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1668277
Change-Id: I7b621157fe85945acd99e4f08b6370d2f9c3d44d

commit_message:
Add some metadata logging to root cause ssh failure

Instances aren't getting SSH keys in some circumstances.
This adds a few debug statements to see if the Nova metadata
service thinks an instance has keys.

Related-Bug: #1668958
Change-Id: I3095d3024b62d5ebb4ea9e388a40ed94ef8f832b

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-07 23:47:40.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': "test-requirements drop unused docker-py

This is a leftover from the Midokura PoC which in turn had it as a
leftover of the pre-split openstack/kuryr. Let's get rid of ths false
dependency since we'll use kubernetes-incubator/client-python anyway for

Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
test-requirements drop unused docker-py

This is a leftover from the Midokura PoC which in turn had it as a
leftover of the pre-split openstack/kuryr. Let's get rid of ths false
dependency since we'll use kubernetes-incubator/client-python anyway for
the purpose we used docker-py in the kuryr-libnetwork tests.

Change-Id: Ic15a24c3970455dd2f8e89daa396cdf7c58e774c
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-13 22:47:07.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': 'DNM: Multicell test hack

This hack (which we could actually use) configures nova-api to use
cell0 as its main database connection. This has the effect of
allowing us to flush out an non-cells-aware API code by effectively
making our only cell with compute notes behave like a secondary one.

Change-Id: I68b148dc393c90b342276b43e12bc3cca18d313c
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Multicell test hack

This hack (which we could actually use) configures nova-api to use
cell0 as its main database connection. This has the effect of
allowing us to flush out an non-cells-aware API code by effectively
making our only cell with compute notes behave like a secondary one.

Change-Id: I68b148dc393c90b342276b43e12bc3cca18d313c

subject: Print out network configuration data in net-info
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-15 17:47:44.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml'], 'message': "Print out network configuration data in net-info

There has been a few scenarios where eth1 doesn't get an IP
address which results in subnodes being unaccessible and
builds failing.

This patch prints out the information consumed by Glean in
order to help troubleshoot the issue and figure out the
root cause of the issue if it occurs again.

Change-Id: Ifd50e83fe3d73064b9141ed62380ec57277241d7
"}]
commit_message:
Print out network configuration data in net-info

There has been a few scenarios where eth1 doesn't get an IP
address which results in subnodes being unaccessible and
builds failing.

This patch prints out the information consumed by Glean in
order to help troubleshoot the issue and figure out the
root cause of the issue if it occurs again.

Change-Id: Ifd50e83fe3d73064b9141ed62380ec57277241d7

For virtuozzo containers we create ephemeral disk based on ploop format.
After we create ploop disk, we should add 'read 'permission for all users.
It's necessary because openstack user query info of this disk by qemu-img.

Change-Id: I2d6dd043340322d4c4ac1efd38f993f08932a483
Implements: blueprint ephemeral-disk-ploop

commit_message:
libvirt: ephemeral disk support for virtuozzo containers

For virtuozzo containers we create ephemeral disk based on ploop format.
After we create ploop disk, we should add 'read 'permission for all users.
It's necessary because openstack user query info of this disk by qemu-img.

Change-Id: I2d6dd043340322d4c4ac1efd38f993f08932a483
Implements: blueprint ephemeral-disk-ploop

commit_message:
release keystoneclient 3.5.1 for stable/newton

includes fixes for:
  - not logging service token in debug mode
  - not logging binary data for responses in debug mode
  - not logging binary data for requests in debug mode

See-Also: I4694ac88766083940496c4ab89e78726d258f87a
(cherry picked from commit 9f9029a1e5ceccd65b8c7b359f6c26f97f5d9fb1)

Change-Id: Ib97ddcf686a83fa1186a7a3017c6edb46282d498

subject: Revert "release keystoneclient 3.5.1 for stable/newton"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-15 01:23:47.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/newton/python-keystoneclient.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "release keystoneclient 3.5.1 for stable/newton"

For reasons we can no longer determine this never triggered the post
pipeline and therefore was never actually released.

The point of this revert is the "re-release" 3.5.1 so the git history is
as accurate as possible and release timestamps also match the git
timestamps.

This reverts commit 9f9029a1e5ceccd65b8c7b359f6c26f97f5d9fb1.

Change-Id: I4694ac88766083940496c4ab89e78726d258f87a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "release keystoneclient 3.5.1 for stable/newton"

For reasons we can no longer determine this never triggered the post
pipeline and therefore was never actually released.

The point of this revert is the "re-release" 3.5.1 so the git history is
as accurate as possible and release timestamps also match the git
timestamps.

This reverts commit 9f9029a1e5ceccd65b8c7b359f6c26f97f5d9fb1.

Change-Id: I4694ac88766083940496c4ab89e78726d258f87a

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 02:20:19.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/heat_launcher.py'], 'message': 'undercloud deploy, delete heat containers

Currently the containerised undercloud deploy leaves behind the
stopped containers used to run db_sync and getent. This change
specifies docker run --rm so that these containers are removed when
they exit.

Change-Id: Ia1615cc6280e193fb17eb612ab874d3593bb06be
'}]
commit_message:
undercloud deploy, delete heat containers

Currently the containerised undercloud deploy leaves behind the
stopped containers used to run db_sync and getent. This change
specifies docker run --rm so that these containers are removed when
they exit.

Change-Id: Ia1615cc6280e193fb17eb612ab874d3593bb06be

having the same hypervisor_hostname attribute.
Since the Placement service has an unique constraint against the
ResourceProvider name which is set by the hypervisor_hostname value, I prefer
to have the compute node using the hostname value for the hypervisor_hostname
field.

Partially-implements: blueprint resource-providers-scheduler-db-filters

Change-Id: Iea8e5760da867c237555aa81768d4feacf9a4f07
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the FakeDriver using same hypervisor names

The FakeDriver was using a global variable for getting the list of nodes so
when trying to create two compute nodes in the functional tests, both were
having the same hypervisor_hostname attribute.
Since the Placement service has an unique constraint against the
ResourceProvider name which is set by the hypervisor_hostname value, I prefer
to have the compute node using the hostname value for the hypervisor_hostname
field.

Partially-implements: blueprint resource-providers-scheduler-db-filters

Change-Id: Iea8e5760da867c237555aa81768d4feacf9a4f07

commit_message:
Install python-tempestconf explicitely

* As currently openstack-tempest rpm installs python-tempestconf
  package which creates a circular dependency ad python-tempestconf
  is dependent on tempest. In order to avoid this, we need to install
  python-tempestconf seperately.

Change-Id: I833fe66c6a0d08598c238b4c49c54bc1c93cefcd

commit_message:
Fix invalid exception mock for InvalidNUMANodesNumber

There is a required field of "nodes" for this exception, which our
mock was not providing. This created a warning spam during test runs
(though it did not actually fail the tests).

commit_message:
playbooks: roles: bifrost-ironic-install: Verify checksum for IPA files

Use the newly published checksum files to verify the integrity of the
downloaded IPA files. If verification fails, we try a few more times
before we give up since that would either mean that there is a
connectivity issue on our end or a problem with the uploaded files.
Checksum verification is enabled by default but it can be easily
disabled in case we do a non-upstream build with no checksum files
available.

Depends-On: I66afa3682ee1461ba1cdb68a134eaa4fd85af4e0
Change-Id: I7b3cad1b42e297b87ca839d66a16303250e27404

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-11 13:50:42.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent_base_vendor.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/agent_base_vendor.py'], 'message': "Move heartbeat processing to separate mixin class

Ironic already exposes heartbeat endpoint in top-level,
driver-independent REST API.
As an Ironic API heartbeater can be implemented as much simpler
script/startup job than whole Ironic Python Agent inside the deploy ramdisk,
let us allow out-of-tree drivers which are not IPA-based to re-use
base ironic heartbeat processing implementation as is.

This patch moves the 'heartbeat' method to a separate HeartbeatMixin
class, and also provides dummy implementations of methods called from
within the 'heartbeat' method for reference.
Drivers that do not depend on IPA but still would like to use heartbeat
functionality may inherit from this class and override self._client in
their __init__ to None or False to suppress collecting logs from
ramdisk on failure.

As a side-effect of such change, method `_refresh_clean_steps` is turned to
public one (leading underscore removed).

This change should be completely trasparent to current consumers of
ironic driver API and has no effect on them.

Change-Id: Ia7987342aef1910c5f4042604ab5076bf4e035e9
"}]
commit_message:
Move heartbeat processing to separate mixin class

Ironic already exposes heartbeat endpoint in top-level,
driver-independent REST API.
As an Ironic API heartbeater can be implemented as much simpler
script/startup job than whole Ironic Python Agent inside the deploy ramdisk,
let us allow out-of-tree drivers which are not IPA-based to re-use
base ironic heartbeat processing implementation as is.

This patch moves the 'heartbeat' method to a separate HeartbeatMixin
class, and also provides dummy implementations of methods called from
within the 'heartbeat' method for reference.
Drivers that do not depend on IPA but still would like to use heartbeat
functionality may inherit from this class and override self._client in
their __init__ to None or False to suppress collecting logs from
ramdisk on failure.

As a side-effect of such change, method `_refresh_clean_steps` is turned to
public one (leading underscore removed).

This change should be completely trasparent to current consumers of
ironic driver API and has no effect on them.

Change-Id: Ia7987342aef1910c5f4042604ab5076bf4e035e9

Replace ALL "tag" parameter with "vlan_start"

Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

subject: Remove support for py34 for heat
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-10 06:22:04.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34 for heat

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ic7b3fb3ff7b68cf280e36335aa9cacd644cc877a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34 for heat

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ic7b3fb3ff7b68cf280e36335aa9cacd644cc877a

commit_message:
Sync deployment tasks product-way

Deployment tasks are now stored in both /etc/puppet and /etc/fuel
directories. We have to sync both directories - fortunately we can just
reuse part of fuel master node preparation
Also rewrite it for using SSHManager

Change-Id: I54402f7b8032771d9156da6937df9cfba1d6b534
Closes-bug:1673084

subject: Prevent unnecessary floating IP dissociate during updating extra attributes
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-03-01 06:57:20.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn.py'], 'message': 'Prevent unnecessary floating IP dissociate during updating extra attributes

If try to update extra attributes, such as description, the floating
IP nat rules will be removed from OVN DBs once, which is unnecessary
and causing connection lose.

This patch will make the floating IP association status check more
specific.

Change-Id: Ia0fb12fdc34893c6ab0defa67007dc51d0f6e7d6
Closes-Bug: #1662405
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent unnecessary floating IP dissociate during updating extra attributes

If try to update extra attributes, such as description, the floating
IP nat rules will be removed from OVN DBs once, which is unnecessary
and causing connection lose.

This patch will make the floating IP association status check more
specific.

Change-Id: Ia0fb12fdc34893c6ab0defa67007dc51d0f6e7d6
Closes-Bug: #1662405

dsvm-functional test_dhcp_options failed in CentOS 7.3

An DHCP option assert error occurred, it only appears on CentOS 7.X
version rather than Ubuntu 16.04.
This is not a functional bug, so simply adjust the test code to repair
the failure.

Closes-bug: 1668834

subject: Use HostAddressOpt for store opts that accept IP and hostnames
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-09 19:53:08.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/vmware_datastore.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/sheepdog.py'], 'message': 'Use HostAddressOpt for store opts that accept IP and hostnames

The glance_store configuration options: ``sheepdog_store_address``
and ``vmware_server_host`` accept both IP addresses and hostnames.
Since there was no specific OSLO opt type to support this, we were
using ``StrOpt``. The change [1] that added support for
``HostAddressOpt`` type was merged in Ocata and became available for
use with oslo version 3.22.

This patch changes the opt type of these 2 glance_store configuration
options to use this more relevant opt type - HostAddressOpt.

[1] I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb

Change-Id: I43fec064815395b8a57e7ef21e43dcbe4d41066e
'}]
commit_message:
Use HostAddressOpt for store opts that accept IP and hostnames

The glance_store configuration options: ``sheepdog_store_address``
and ``vmware_server_host`` accept both IP addresses and hostnames.
Since there was no specific OSLO opt type to support this, we were
using ``StrOpt``. The change [1] that added support for
``HostAddressOpt`` type was merged in Ocata and became available for
use with oslo version 3.22.

This patch changes the opt type of these 2 glance_store configuration
options to use this more relevant opt type - HostAddressOpt.

[1] I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb

Change-Id: I43fec064815395b8a57e7ef21e43dcbe4d41066e

commit_message:
Removal of re-switching of rbac-role from tearDown

Currently, for every test case class, we need to add
re-switching rbac role in tearDown method. Thus for
every testcase using the tearDown method becomes
mandatory.

This patch removes tearDown dependency for re-switching
rbac-role.

Co-Authored-By: Mh Raies <mh.raies@ericsson.com>
Co-Authored-By: Felipe Monteiro <felipe.monteiro@att.com>

Implements: blueprint refactor-teardown-switch-roles
Change-Id: I3f0026533255c87b8128f2bf3a4aa488382a2523

commit_message:
Disable functional tests for nodepool gearman-zk-shim

They only test features that we're removing from the shim, so don't
bother running the jobs. Also, we don't care about code coverage, so
don't waste time on it. Also, we don't publish docs for it, so don't run
those either.

Change-Id: Ia3969c950d511d39e944b94509070c79764e4389

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2017-03-15 04:31:09.000000000', 'files': ['etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/dibbler.filters', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dibbler.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha.py', 'neutron/tests/common/l3_test_common.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_pd.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/pd.py'], 'message': 'Add PD support in HA router

The following enhancements are added:
  -- PD keeps track of status of neutron routers: active or
     standalone (master), or standby (not master),
  -- PD DHCP clients are only spawned in the active router. In the
     standby router, PD keeps track of the assigned prefixes, but
     doesn't spawn DHCP clients.
  -- When switchover occurs, on the router becoming standby, PD
     clients are "killed" so that they don't send prefix withdrawals
     to the DHCP server. On the router becoming active, PD spawns DHCP
     clients with the assigned prefixes configured as hints in the
     DHCP client's configuration

Closes-Bug: #1651465
Change-Id: I17df98128c7a88e72e31251687f30f569df6b860
'}]
commit_message:
Add PD support in HA router

The following enhancements are added:
  -- PD keeps track of status of neutron routers: active or
     standalone (master), or standby (not master),
  -- PD DHCP clients are only spawned in the active router. In the
     standby router, PD keeps track of the assigned prefixes, but
     doesn't spawn DHCP clients.
  -- When switchover occurs, on the router becoming standby, PD
     clients are "killed" so that they don't send prefix withdrawals
     to the DHCP server. On the router becoming active, PD spawns DHCP
     clients with the assigned prefixes configured as hints in the
     DHCP client's configuration

Closes-Bug: #1651465
Change-Id: I17df98128c7a88e72e31251687f30f569df6b860

commit_message:
Add ironic::drivers::interfaces class

This patch adds a new class ironic::drivers::interfaces that
will configure interfaces on ironic conductor side.
This patch allows to configure enabled_network_interfaces field.

subject: Fallback to the first subnet inside the pool
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-22 19:53:25.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_libnetwork/tests/unit/test_kuryr_ipam.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/controllers.py'], 'message': 'Fallback to the first subnet inside the pool

In ipam_request_address, if there multiple subnets inside the
subnetpool and none of the subnets has a matching cidr, pick the
first subnet and print a warning. Otherwise, an error will raise
for complaining no subnet was found, which is suboptimal.

In addition, there is a minor cleanup on the unit test.

Change-Id: Ia668b36b4781b65928c227d61b3baff12147ff00
Related-Bug: #1665039
'}]
commit_message:
Fallback to the first subnet inside the pool

In ipam_request_address, if there multiple subnets inside the
subnetpool and none of the subnets has a matching cidr, pick the
first subnet and print a warning. Otherwise, an error will raise
for complaining no subnet was found, which is suboptimal.

In addition, there is a minor cleanup on the unit test.

Change-Id: Ia668b36b4781b65928c227d61b3baff12147ff00
Related-Bug: #1665039

commit_message:
Update MidoNet plugin manifest

The MidoNet API no longer exists with that name. We are deprecating its
parameters and replacing them by its counterpart "cluster".

Also the dependency python-networking-midonet-ext package is removed as
this is only needed for the N release. Will be added when backported.

Change-Id: Ia85bc41c05d766f995835941ed5fc46ce5465334

commit_message:
Make decision wheter to build images in CI or not

Instead of using canusecache function, make a script that could
be used by quickstart to determine quickly if we need to build
image or download ready from mirror server.
Usages:
    - bash: if $(to_build); then ...
    - ansible: when: {{ lookup('pipe', 'path/to/to_build')|bool }}

Change-Id: Id5aefcf588ef984be6de07e4c7e76b5a4c5e93ad

commit_message:
pbr.version.VersionInfo needs package name (oslo.xyz and not oslo_xyz)

 We need to pass into VersionInfo what one would expect from running:
 setup.py --name

 Right now we pass in say oslo_context and pbr fails if there is no .git in
  the python source tree

  Closes-Bug: #1662266

Change-Id: I45d2edddfd516f65e1589e9b7816f1256e3f0d24
(cherry picked from commit f33bb02c8239eed78c7e9ef2f45cef5c271bee75)

commit_message:
Add cAdvisor host plugin

Queries a given cAdvisor instance for host metrics. This is useful
when the agent in running in a container and does not have access
to all host level metrics

Taken from original review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391559/

subject: Send out notifications when instance tags changed
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-15 02:19:43.000000000', 'files': ['specs/pike/approved/send-tag-notification.rst'], 'message': 'Send out notifications when instance tags changed

Tag instance was added in microversion 2.26, tags have a separate
DB table and it is only related to the instance only by instance
uuid. Currently, when instance tag added, updated or deleted,no
notification will be send out. Other services like Searchlight
have no way to know this information except call instance/detail API.

Since tags are designed to be used for filter instances, and
up-to-date sync really matters for services that provide advanced
search like Searchlight,

This spec propose to add notification for tags actions.

Change-Id: Ia1e736385ce32ebc7ac0ea8f0af6a75b74eb6c68
Blueprint: send-tag-notification
'}]
commit_message:
Send out notifications when instance tags changed

Tag instance was added in microversion 2.26, tags have a separate
DB table and it is only related to the instance only by instance
uuid. Currently, when instance tag added, updated or deleted,no
notification will be send out. Other services like Searchlight
have no way to know this information except call instance/detail API.

Since tags are designed to be used for filter instances, and
up-to-date sync really matters for services that provide advanced
search like Searchlight,

This spec propose to add notification for tags actions.

Change-Id: Ia1e736385ce32ebc7ac0ea8f0af6a75b74eb6c68
Blueprint: send-tag-notification

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2017-03-02 18:04:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/client/__init__.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/scheduler/client/report.py', 'nova/virt/driver.py', 'nova/objects/fields.py', 'nova/tests/functional/compute/__init__.py', 'nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_client.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py', 'nova/tests/functional/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/test_report_client.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': 'placement: ironic inventory reporting

This patch adds a new virt driver API method called get_inventory() that
takes the nodename as a parameter and returns a dict, keyed by resource
class, of inventory information. The only virt driver that has an
implementation of the new get_inventory() method is the Ironic virt
driver, which, in this patch, returns both the legacy VCPU, MEMORY_MB
and DISK_GB resource classes as well as the new custom resource class
for the Ironic node, if present.

The resource tracker's _update() method was modified to first call the
virt driver get_inventory() method to get a Placement-aligned dictionary
of inventory/resource information and call a new
set_inventory_for_provider() method on the scheduler reporting client.
If the get_inventory() method is not implemented by the virt driver,
then the resource tracker falls back to calling the existing
update_resource_stats() scheduler reporting client method which analyses
the compute node object and constructs an inventory dict that the
placement API understands.

For Ironic, because of the contract we have with the Ironic team, this
code auto-creates custom resource classes that come in from the Ironic
virt driver from the node's resource_class attribute. For all other
drivers, we do not auto-create resource classes in the placement API.

Note that we DO NOT yet *consume* the custom resource class inventory
during instance_claim() against an Ironic node. Once flavors are
modified to have the "resources:$CUSTOM_RESOURCE_CLASS=1" extra spec and
the scheduler will construct a request to consume *only* the custom
resource class, at that point we will correct the allocation records for
Ironic resource providers.

Change-Id: I4ac9dd6798576e5a9bb872d03dd2713053c39b68
blueprint: custom-resource-classes-pike
'}]
commit_message:
placement: ironic inventory reporting

This patch adds a new virt driver API method called get_inventory() that
takes the nodename as a parameter and returns a dict, keyed by resource
class, of inventory information. The only virt driver that has an
implementation of the new get_inventory() method is the Ironic virt
driver, which, in this patch, returns both the legacy VCPU, MEMORY_MB
and DISK_GB resource classes as well as the new custom resource class
for the Ironic node, if present.

The resource tracker's _update() method was modified to first call the
virt driver get_inventory() method to get a Placement-aligned dictionary
of inventory/resource information and call a new
set_inventory_for_provider() method on the scheduler reporting client.
If the get_inventory() method is not implemented by the virt driver,
then the resource tracker falls back to calling the existing
update_resource_stats() scheduler reporting client method which analyses
the compute node object and constructs an inventory dict that the
placement API understands.

For Ironic, because of the contract we have with the Ironic team, this
code auto-creates custom resource classes that come in from the Ironic
virt driver from the node's resource_class attribute. For all other
drivers, we do not auto-create resource classes in the placement API.

Note that we DO NOT yet *consume* the custom resource class inventory
during instance_claim() against an Ironic node. Once flavors are
modified to have the "resources:$CUSTOM_RESOURCE_CLASS=1" extra spec and
the scheduler will construct a request to consume *only* the custom
resource class, at that point we will correct the allocation records for
Ironic resource providers.

Change-Id: I4ac9dd6798576e5a9bb872d03dd2713053c39b68
blueprint: custom-resource-classes-pike

subject: Improve logs for the root device hints mechanism
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11076, 'name': 'Shivanand Tendulker', 'email': 'stendulker@gmail.com', 'username': 'stendulker'}, {'_account_id': 13295, 'name': 'Mario Villaplana', 'email': 'mario.villaplana@gmail.com', 'username': 'mariojv'}, {'_account_id': 14525, 'name': 'Vasyl Saienko', 'email': 'vsaienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vsaienko'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-09 10:46:54.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_lib/utils.py'], 'message': "Improve logs for the root device hints mechanism

Troubleshooting the root device hints mechanism is not trivial, mostly
because the rules for the hints can be complex and also the machine
could have many disks.

This patch is an attempt to improve the logs by:

* Change the level of some of the logs where it makes sense
* Add a debug log right before the actual comparison happen
* Log the device's name (a.k.a path, e.g: /dev/sda) instead of the
  object instance str representation, which doesn't make sense in
  the logs.

Closes-Bug: #1671416
Change-Id: I7c5a12436d1ebbd418487ec7a28585a500022c61

commit_message:
Improve logs for the root device hints mechanism

Troubleshooting the root device hints mechanism is not trivial, mostly
because the rules for the hints can be complex and also the machine
could have many disks.

This patch is an attempt to improve the logs by:

* Change the level of some of the logs where it makes sense
* Add a debug log right before the actual comparison happen
* Log the device's name (a.k.a path, e.g: /dev/sda) instead of the
  object instance str representation, which doesn't make sense in
  the logs.

Closes-Bug: #1671416
Change-Id: I7c5a12436d1ebbd418487ec7a28585a500022c61

commit_message:
Fix for failure caused by missing primary creds

cls.os_adm is managed by 'admin' credentials.
cls.alt_os is managed by 'alt' credentilas.
Similarly, cls.os is managed by 'primary' credentials.

Currently, in test_volume_transfers_rbac.py file, it is evaluating
clients with cls.os without providing 'primary' credentials.
Because of this, failure is coming.

This patch provides fix for this.

Closes-Bug: #1672859
Change-Id: I6b6fcdc493c1c401d9851d01d7ccd05e199a4cd0

Currently if there is a package in requirements which
needs to be built from one of the git clones, it will
not work unless the related host group is populated.
This is due to the fact that the selective git clone
hinges on the host group population.

This patch adds an extra check for each git clone to
validate whether the package is in the requirements
list too. If it is, then it will clone the git source
regardless of the host group population.

Change-Id: Id121a1bcd91f688c8fab41de0b74b5b8196f8b44
Closes-Bug: #1671958
'}]
commit_message:
Include git clone for packages in requirements

Currently if there is a package in requirements which
needs to be built from one of the git clones, it will
not work unless the related host group is populated.
This is due to the fact that the selective git clone
hinges on the host group population.

This patch adds an extra check for each git clone to
validate whether the package is in the requirements
list too. If it is, then it will clone the git source
regardless of the host group population.

Change-Id: Id121a1bcd91f688c8fab41de0b74b5b8196f8b44
Closes-Bug: #1671958

commit_message:
Adopt operation for nova server profile

This adds the operation support for adopting an existing server.
There are still some items we cannot get from nova server, due to Nova
API limitations, but the current support should be okay for most use
cases if users don't care much about 'user_data'.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-15 13:53:48.000000000', 'files': ['releasetools/cmds/mail.py'], 'message': "fix mail sending

Correct the logic related to parsing the server address so that the
default is not overwritten if there is no @ in the address.

Fix handling of a missing password by allowing an empty string to mean
no password was given.

Move the TO parsing out of the try/finally block so that errors in
parsing the message are not swallowed by errors when we quit a server
connection that wasn't opened properly.

Change-Id: I73a24a4d87c0f4a5aabd302d8a7d2884e5513c31
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
fix mail sending

Correct the logic related to parsing the server address so that the
default is not overwritten if there is no @ in the address.

Fix handling of a missing password by allowing an empty string to mean
no password was given.

Move the TO parsing out of the try/finally block so that errors in
parsing the message are not swallowed by errors when we quit a server
connection that wasn't opened properly.

Change-Id: I73a24a4d87c0f4a5aabd302d8a7d2884e5513c31
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10184, 'name': 'Nuage CI', 'email': 'nuage-ci@nuagenetworks.net', 'username': 'nuage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14571, 'name': 'Intel Experimental CI', 'email': 'openstack-networking-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20330, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V Networking CI', 'email': 'microsoft_neutron_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_neutron_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-15 04:27:42.000000000', 'files': ['rally-jobs/neutron-neutron.yaml'], 'message': 'Trim rally scenario sizes

During a normal run, the top three scenarios account for slightly
more than a half hour of runtime. Sample numbers:

Scenario                                    Load Duration Full Duration
NeutronNetworks.create_and_update_subnets       562.189   1,182.400
NeutronTrunks.create_and_list_trunk_subports    427.475    600.721
NeutronNetworks.create_and_list_ports           310.167    540.144

This patch reduces the resources created by each of the 3 by 75%. This
should save us an additional ~20 minutes during a normal gate run, which
should change our window for timeout from approximately a half hour on a
normal node to about 50 minutes.

This additional buffer should hopefully be enough to reduce the failure
rate for the rally job when it gets scheduled to a slow node.

Change-Id: I923b625f7dd3ebf794b6a9e097f5ed12ce446bb5
'}]
commit_message:
Trim rally scenario sizes

During a normal run, the top three scenarios account for slightly
more than a half hour of runtime. Sample numbers:

Scenario                                    Load Duration Full Duration
NeutronNetworks.create_and_update_subnets       562.189   1,182.400
NeutronTrunks.create_and_list_trunk_subports    427.475    600.721
NeutronNetworks.create_and_list_ports           310.167    540.144

This patch reduces the resources created by each of the 3 by 75%. This
should save us an additional ~20 minutes during a normal gate run, which
should change our window for timeout from approximately a half hour on a
normal node to about 50 minutes.

This additional buffer should hopefully be enough to reduce the failure
rate for the rally job when it gets scheduled to a slow node.

Change-Id: I923b625f7dd3ebf794b6a9e097f5ed12ce446bb5

commit_message:
conf: Fix invalid rST comments

These were breaking the openstack-docs-tools build, which is used to
build the central config guide. We should probably add a unit tests to
ensure all config options use valid (or at least, error-free) rST, but
that's a job for another day.

Change-Id: I28a5df801fa594180ab374569f06791f05938ba2

When deleting an instance we look it up in the _get_instance
method and if it's in cell0 then the context is permanently
targeted to that cell via the set_target_cell method.

When we delete the instance in _delete we need to temporarily

the quota usage gets decremented in the cell0 database rather than

commit_message:
Temporarily untarget context when deleting from cell0

When deleting an instance we look it up in the _get_instance
method and if it's in cell0 then the context is permanently
targeted to that cell via the set_target_cell method.

When we delete the instance in _delete we need to temporarily
untarget the context when we decrement the quota usage otherwise
the quota usage gets decremented in the cell0 database rather than
the cell database. Once the instance is deleted then we
re-apply the target cell on the context.

Change-Id: I7de87dce216835729283bca69f0eff59a679b624
Closes-Bug: #1670627

subject: Add DHCP requests allowing ACL rule for OVN native DHCP
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-13 12:03:47.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/common/test_acl.py', 'networking_ovn/common/acl.py'], 'message': 'Add DHCP requests allowing ACL rule for OVN native DHCP

Delete default egress security group rule and add a new one with
--remote-group, then DHCP requests from VM are dropped by OVS flow
and VM can not acquire a DHCP IP.
This patch adds a rule to allow DHCP requests passing through OVN ACL.

Change-Id: I6213009cd4e8c01cfaf6de7e57e5644662bc34c4
Closes-Bug: #1670663
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add DHCP requests allowing ACL rule for OVN native DHCP

Delete default egress security group rule and add a new one with
--remote-group, then DHCP requests from VM are dropped by OVS flow
and VM can not acquire a DHCP IP.
This patch adds a rule to allow DHCP requests passing through OVN ACL.

Change-Id: I6213009cd4e8c01cfaf6de7e57e5644662bc34c4
Closes-Bug: #1670663
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

subject: Do not use backports repo if it is deliberately not enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-15 13:05:23.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lxc_install_apt.yml'], 'message': 'Do not use backports repo if it is deliberately not enabled

In https://review.openstack.org/442592 the option to not use
the backports repo for Ubuntu Trusty was added to allow a
deployer to use their own consolidated apt mirror.

This configuration fails due to the default_release argument
in the apt package installation.

This patch ensures that the default_release argument is omitted
if the backports repo addition is deliberately disabled.

Change-Id: If3ec51a4d518bf159f3f13ad5865fb665118b2d1
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use backports repo if it is deliberately not enabled

In https://review.openstack.org/442592 the option to not use
the backports repo for Ubuntu Trusty was added to allow a
deployer to use their own consolidated apt mirror.

This configuration fails due to the default_release argument
in the apt package installation.

This patch ensures that the default_release argument is omitted
if the backports repo addition is deliberately disabled.

Change-Id: If3ec51a4d518bf159f3f13ad5865fb665118b2d1

commit_message:
HAProxy: Refactor certificate retrieval bits

This moves the certificate request bits to simplify the profile and move
the logic to the HAProxy/certmonger specific manifest.

This is a small iteration on the effort to separate the certificate
retrieval to its own manifest since this part won't be containerized
yet.

Change-Id: Ibb01cd9a59049e4728615cb4f37e5bfac5800a92

commit_message:
Force clean yum metadata when repo config changes

When changing the repo URL, the metadata does not reliably
update, resulting in the right URL being used, but the
wrong package list. This is why we force the metadata to be
cleaned out whenever the repo config changes.

Change-Id: I9bca9a89b58cd539dd5c224d6b141dc4d844bcc2
(cherry picked from commit 1da7340a99328d4d7d89bbcdb9986b4e6c975a67)

commit_message:
Make port bind on dual-stack port

For the container boot from dual-stack network, request_address
will create two ports(with v4 and v6 address), we should only
allow one for port bind.

This patch delete the previous created ports, and then
create a new port with same v4 and v6 ip address.

Change-Id: I99ebc22f1c65b91e82a15247aee9b8d7e623a4a3
Partially-Implements: blueprint ipv6-subnet
Closes-Bug: #1670590

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-27 15:56:59.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/test_linuxscsi.py', 'os_brick/initiator/linuxscsi.py'], 'message': 'Retry multipath flush when map is in use

When flushing a multipath we are ignoring map in use transient error, so
we log a warning that the flush has not been successful and that we have
received an exit code 1 and we continue to remove the individual paths.

This error is usually transient and a simple retry will succeed in
flushing the multipath.

Failure to retry will leave an empty multipath in our system.

Closes-Bug: #1663936
Change-Id: I710792bd707ad933ef60d11d25f530dddfb6fb2f
'}]
commit_message:
Retry multipath flush when map is in use

When flushing a multipath we are ignoring map in use transient error, so
we log a warning that the flush has not been successful and that we have
received an exit code 1 and we continue to remove the individual paths.

This error is usually transient and a simple retry will succeed in
flushing the multipath.

Failure to retry will leave an empty multipath in our system.

Closes-Bug: #1663936
Change-Id: I710792bd707ad933ef60d11d25f530dddfb6fb2f

commit_message:
Replace unconditional wait for compute kit

Currently After the compute kit charts are deployed, the gate task
unconditionally wait for 10 minutes before running basic tests. This
patch replaces unconditional wait timer for a function which verifies
services individually and if the services are up, exit with 0.

Change-Id: Id1bc147b824fc73d3652db909846adeb9c89cce2
Closes-Bug: #1664322

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-27 15:56:59.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_fibre_channel.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/test_linuxscsi.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connectors/fibre_channel.py', 'os_brick/initiator/linuxscsi.py'], 'message': "Fix multipath flush when using friendly names

When we are using friendly names for multipath the multipaths are not
getting flushed, which may lead to data loss on slow connections and
multipath entries with no actual paths.

This happens in both iSCSI and FC connections, and it is due to the
flush being requested on the WWN instead of the actual name of the
device.

So when we are not using friendly names the WWN and the device name are
the same and our call to multipath -f will successfully flush remaining
data, but when we are using friendly names they will not match, and the
call to multipath -f will silently fail (return code 0) and the flush
will not actually go through. When the flush doesn't happen, if there is
remaining data, then the multipath will stay once the individual paths
have been removed.

Closes-Bug: #1663925
Change-Id: Ib93d945a5b5fca57bcac4e176d62d1412b95f2da
"}]
commit_message:
Fix multipath flush when using friendly names

When we are using friendly names for multipath the multipaths are not
getting flushed, which may lead to data loss on slow connections and
multipath entries with no actual paths.

This happens in both iSCSI and FC connections, and it is due to the
flush being requested on the WWN instead of the actual name of the
device.

So when we are not using friendly names the WWN and the device name are
the same and our call to multipath -f will successfully flush remaining
data, but when we are using friendly names they will not match, and the
call to multipath -f will silently fail (return code 0) and the flush
will not actually go through. When the flush doesn't happen, if there is
remaining data, then the multipath will stay once the individual paths
have been removed.

Closes-Bug: #1663925
Change-Id: Ib93d945a5b5fca57bcac4e176d62d1412b95f2da

commit_message:
Mark 'undercloud deploy' as experimental

This patch marks the 'undercloud deploy' feature as experimental
for Pike. There is not yet agreement on when this will (if ever)
replace instack-undercloud. Until then I think marking it as
experimental is wise to avoid confusion should we release Pike
without converting 'undercloud install' to make use of this.

Change-Id: Id6f1343994429db2feb8250332dd9e1c62b73fde

revisions:

Non-developers will overwhelmingly install the UI via the "openstack
undercloud" command, which means using puppet-tripleo to manage the UI
configuration file. If we want new languages to be picked up and
available for a normal install, the UI puppet manifest also needs to be
updated as part of enabling a new language.

Change-Id: I46fa539f70552e37109086f377854b9e4da7730c
'}]
commit_message:
Add puppet to "adding a new language" docs

Non-developers will overwhelmingly install the UI via the "openstack
undercloud" command, which means using puppet-tripleo to manage the UI
configuration file. If we want new languages to be picked up and
available for a normal install, the UI puppet manifest also needs to be
updated as part of enabling a new language.

Change-Id: I46fa539f70552e37109086f377854b9e4da7730c

commit_message:
WIP Fixes Category Package Count not showing in Dashboard+GLARE.

The Browse > Browse Local screen's App Category drop-down does
not currently show package count with GLARE enabled. This is
also the case in Manage > Categories page.

This change shows package count with GLARE on both these screens,
and updates functional tests to work with changes.

Change-Id: I24f6e19587aa0ea1d96e0bda9e003c14fc44b4be

commit_message:
Add "list Glance API versions" test

Many projects provides multiple API versions and the version
information is very important for users, because users can know
what features are available on clouds. However, Tempest didn't
test the Clance API versions in long-term. So this patch adds
the corresponding test.

Change-Id: Ib85819fb71f0b12b64351b307d83a3beb77d7fad

commit_message:
Fix HNAS snapshot management section

This commit introduces a minor fix in the HNAS config reference wrt
snapshot management. The previous phrasing was a little imprecise as to
the necessary folder structure for existing and newly created snapshots.

Change-Id: Ic7fce241e8ade20c9fe97da69b0ae4643c83c0d2

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-10 00:33:57.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'message': "RBD driver doesn't flatten image when clone depth > configured value.

RBD driver has a rbd_max_clone_depth config option which would trigger
image flatten operation when a RBD image has been chain-cloned to that
value.  But the driver only trigger flatten when actual clone depth
equals rbd_max_clone_depth.  There are cases where actual clone depth
is bigger than rbd_max_clone_depth (for example: admin somehow changed
rbd_max_clone_depth from a bigger value to a smaller value),
auto-flatten won't be triggered.  This change allows RBD driver to
flatten image has been cloned >= rbd_max_clone_depth.

Closes-Bug: #1644129

Change-Id: Ic6e62ffcb4aded6ee9a652a1f4d0a1db5eac0ceb
"}]
commit_message:
RBD driver doesn't flatten image when clone depth > configured value.

RBD driver has a rbd_max_clone_depth config option which would trigger
image flatten operation when a RBD image has been chain-cloned to that
value.  But the driver only trigger flatten when actual clone depth
equals rbd_max_clone_depth.  There are cases where actual clone depth
is bigger than rbd_max_clone_depth (for example: admin somehow changed
rbd_max_clone_depth from a bigger value to a smaller value),
auto-flatten won't be triggered.  This change allows RBD driver to
flatten image has been cloned >= rbd_max_clone_depth.

Closes-Bug: #1644129

Change-Id: Ic6e62ffcb4aded6ee9a652a1f4d0a1db5eac0ceb

subject: NG details view route should not be '/project/...'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 10:29:39.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/static/dashboard/identity/users/users.service.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/core.module.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.service.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/static/dashboard/identity/domains/domains.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.module.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/static/dashboard/identity/users/users.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/static/dashboard/identity/domains/domains.service.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/core-constants.module.js'], 'message': "NG details view route should not be '/project/...'

Right now the route includes the name 'project'
but we may have details view for 'identity' and
'admin' too, so it should be more general.

Picked just 'ngdetails' instead and moved this out as a
constant. Since this constant needs to be used
by the config blocks, I moved it out into its own
constant module.

Change-Id: I7603250dd70eb40568aa74be2ae4821ee8fcefcc
Closes-Bug: #1641250
(cherry picked from commit c73e1c8fa82c8059d0c8e8848413380ab6050ad5)
"}]
commit_message:
NG details view route should not be '/project/...'

Right now the route includes the name 'project'
but we may have details view for 'identity' and
'admin' too, so it should be more general.

Picked just 'ngdetails' instead and moved this out as a
constant. Since this constant needs to be used
by the config blocks, I moved it out into its own
constant module.

Change-Id: I7603250dd70eb40568aa74be2ae4821ee8fcefcc
Closes-Bug: #1641250
(cherry picked from commit c73e1c8fa82c8059d0c8e8848413380ab6050ad5)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-27 15:56:59.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_iscsi.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connectors/iscsi.py', 'os_brick/exception.py'], 'message': "Fix iSCSI multipath rescan

iSCSI multipath rescan uses iscsiadm --rescan option for nodes and
sessions, which can end up recreating devices that had just been removed
if there's a race condition between the removal of a SCSI device and the
connection of a volume.

The race condition happens if a rescan done when attaching happens right
between us removing the path and removing the exported lun, because the
rescan will add not only the new path we are attaching, but the old path
we are removing, since the lun still hasn't been removed.

This would leave orphaned devices that unnecessarily pollute our
environment,

This patch narrows the rescan to only rescan for the specific target id,
channel, and lun number if we can find this information.

When we cannot find this information we do the scan as we were doing it
before.

Closes-Bug: #1664032
Change-Id: I1b3bd34db260165a6ea9ca061f946d6dfcf8553f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix iSCSI multipath rescan

iSCSI multipath rescan uses iscsiadm --rescan option for nodes and
sessions, which can end up recreating devices that had just been removed
if there's a race condition between the removal of a SCSI device and the
connection of a volume.

The race condition happens if a rescan done when attaching happens right
between us removing the path and removing the exported lun, because the
rescan will add not only the new path we are attaching, but the old path
we are removing, since the lun still hasn't been removed.

This would leave orphaned devices that unnecessarily pollute our
environment,

This patch narrows the rescan to only rescan for the specific target id,
channel, and lun number if we can find this information.

When we cannot find this information we do the scan as we were doing it
before.

Closes-Bug: #1664032
Change-Id: I1b3bd34db260165a6ea9ca061f946d6dfcf8553f

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 05:32:58.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/task.rb', 'lib/astute/tasks/puppet.rb', 'spec/unit/tasks/puppet_task_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Astute do not respect debug option for puppet task

Run cluster with enable debug option do not affect
puppet task which always run with debug disable.

It is happened because Nailgun send debug option which
Astute setup for every task, but puppet task required
puppet_debug option to control it behavior. This code
will connect this parameters.

Change-Id: I8df68105aa699e83673c39a0f03bb22673171d6f

(cherry picked from commit 003a0a0efdbedf51fef943586286e00068175b43)

commit_message:
Astute do not respect debug option for puppet task

Run cluster with enable debug option do not affect
puppet task which always run with debug disable.

It is happened because Nailgun send debug option which
Astute setup for every task, but puppet task required
puppet_debug option to control it behavior. This code
will connect this parameters.

Change-Id: I8df68105aa699e83673c39a0f03bb22673171d6f
Closes-Bug: #1662512
(cherry picked from commit 003a0a0efdbedf51fef943586286e00068175b43)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 16:12:07.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/discover.py', 'keystoneclient/_discover.py'], 'message': "Workaround for unmatching scheme in discovery

when doing keystone discovery, there are issues returning the scheme in
specific scenarios: e.g. when keystone is deployed behind a TLS proxy,
and oslo.middleware's http_proxy_to_wsgi is not available.

To workaround this, we could remember the original scheme that was given
as the auth_url, and try to use that in case the URL gotten via
discovery is not working.

Even though this scenario is a common misconfiguration of the
loadbalancer and keystone. This is unfortunately a very common issue.
So working around this in keystoneclient seems like the best way to go,
as it will ease the transition for moving services to use discovery and
not rely on versioned endpoints.

The original patch where this was discussed is this one:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/443104/

Change-Id: I1ee828215d0a0184474021d6236c2bc234af5176
"}]
commit_message:
Workaround for unmatching scheme in discovery

when doing keystone discovery, there are issues returning the scheme in
specific scenarios: e.g. when keystone is deployed behind a TLS proxy,
and oslo.middleware's http_proxy_to_wsgi is not available.

To workaround this, we could remember the original scheme that was given
as the auth_url, and try to use that in case the URL gotten via
discovery is not working.

Even though this scenario is a common misconfiguration of the
loadbalancer and keystone. This is unfortunately a very common issue.
So working around this in keystoneclient seems like the best way to go,
as it will ease the transition for moving services to use discovery and
not rely on versioned endpoints.

The original patch where this was discussed is this one:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/443104/

Change-Id: I1ee828215d0a0184474021d6236c2bc234af5176

commit_message:
Allow newer SQLAlchemy

This removes the < 1.1 cap for global requirements so
that the version bump may be proposed to downstream
projects.   The upper-constraints stays at 1.0.17 until
downstream requirements.txts can all be updated.

Change-Id: I32f37045d8ac4156091ea3e7e9b6e0b3e9463cd7

Since the call could take a while until it reaches ODL it makes more
sense to put the port to active after the request has been sent rather
than when the request to bind the port is received.

Change-Id: I0e9d48e7e4cbe6ada720aae769a23e769e737e57

commit_message:
Set port to ACTIVE in post processing

Since the call could take a while until it reaches ODL it makes more
sense to put the port to active after the request has been sent rather
than when the request to bind the port is received.

This is a temporary solution until a more robust one that relies on
retreiving the port status from the ODL controller is available.

Change-Id: I0e9d48e7e4cbe6ada720aae769a23e769e737e57

commit_message:
Fix SLES platform detection

Surprisingly SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 SP2
returns 'SUSE Linux Enterprise Server ' as its
distribution identifier (note the trailing space).
This change is meant to fix it for now and ever.
Also fixed a misspelled log message.

commit_message:
Fix migration_success before completing

Share task_state was set to migration_success
before completing migration. There was still
updates to the share model to be performed
before completing.

Also, small refactoring in host-assisted
migration's migration_complete that was not
setting the task_state migration_completing
at the proper time, allowing a bigger window
for 2 concurrent migration_complete calls.

Commit 41813736718e2b81d1d907bf49feb1940c1e990f in master
introduced bug 1667450, so we are including partial commit
fae08f97f17b3dc6dfaa8df7679660707c518c3a (except release-notes),
squashing it into this fix.

Change-Id: I88df15446ffe34f3f12770d53c3e03d232f495c2
Closes-bug: #1665072
(cherry picked from commit 41813736718e2b81d1d907bf49feb1940c1e990f)

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-15 04:28:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Remove dependency on strings for kill_process

utils.kill_process() parsed the error string after the kill command
which can lead to internationalization issues. We shouldn't relay upon
different translations so this follow-up patch removes this dependency
by checking if the process is still running after the kill when a
ProcessExecutionError exception occurs.

Before, this was achieved by comparing against "No such process" string

Change-Id: I22bd63992d1029f99fea401f07167383f8ff7dd0
'}]
commit_message:
Remove dependency on strings for kill_process

utils.kill_process() parsed the error string after the kill command
which can lead to internationalization issues. We shouldn't relay upon
different translations so this follow-up patch removes this dependency
by checking if the process is still running after the kill when a
ProcessExecutionError exception occurs.

Before, this was achieved by comparing against "No such process" string

Change-Id: I22bd63992d1029f99fea401f07167383f8ff7dd0

commit_message:
Adds snapshot_image_format configuration

Some filesystems deal better with snapshots in a particular
format to handle deduplication and cloning. This adds support
for configuring this.

Change-Id: Ic3027ac4bb89e8d596a92ba0d517f80a69c65214
Implements: add_snapshot_image_format
Closes-Bug: #1671575

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-14 16:55:40.000000000', 'files': ['docker/heat/heat-base/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Add Apache packages to heat containers

Some projects that use Kolla docker containers (TripleO) run heat under
httpd. This patch adds the httpd package so that it exists in the
container and can optionally by used via Docker entrypoints.

As many of these projects do not require the use of Apache (it is
opt-in) at this point not all deployment frameworks support the use of
it so the existing configuration defaults have been left as-is for now.

Change-Id: I4d648c4ce4f5f6ba311bfbbf9c78e06104163c61
Partially-Implements: blueprint apache-packages-for-apis
'}]
commit_message:
Add Apache packages to heat containers

Some projects that use Kolla docker containers (TripleO) run heat under
httpd. This patch adds the httpd package so that it exists in the
container and can optionally by used via Docker entrypoints.

As many of these projects do not require the use of Apache (it is
opt-in) at this point not all deployment frameworks support the use of
it so the existing configuration defaults have been left as-is for now.

Change-Id: I4d648c4ce4f5f6ba311bfbbf9c78e06104163c61
Partially-Implements: blueprint apache-packages-for-apis

commit_message:
fix blacklisting NovaLike resources

we aren't blacklisting items properly because our NovaLike objects
can't be compared and therefore we can never detect if it has
been blacklisted previously.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-15 00:50:31.000000000', 'files': ['docker/nova/nova-compute/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Add mkfs.vfat to nova-compute source images

Currently Windows and non-declared os_type images (defaults
to Windows) attempt to format ephemeral volumes with
mkfs.vfat but fail as this tool is not available in the
container.

This is resolved by installing dosfstools on the Source
builds (as I believe this is handled in binary builds
through dependencies).

Change-Id: Iefa5fb0a16eed30aea935268f2a9becb1481b018
Closes-bug: #1672199
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>

'}]
commit_message:
Add mkfs.vfat to nova-compute source images

Currently Windows and non-declared os_type images (defaults
to Windows) attempt to format ephemeral volumes with
mkfs.vfat but fail as this tool is not available in the
container.

This is resolved by installing dosfstools on the Source
builds (as I believe this is handled in binary builds
through dependencies).

Change-Id: Iefa5fb0a16eed30aea935268f2a9becb1481b018
Closes-bug: #1672199
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>
(cherry picked from commit 76cae7fe0bb4cfef0fbd1eb232098e7b1e6775eb)

There was a typo in here about the map_cell0 command creating
a db connection with a _nova suffix when it's actually a _cell0
suffix like in the example, nova_cell0.

This also adds a reminder to sync the API database schema before
running the commands and also gives a warning about being
specific when using map_cell0 and having the databases on different
hosts.

Depends-On: I541b072638b5d50985145391e76f610417fdcaa6

Change-Id: Ibf3355217bbd0139a020de352bb62ff7d973d27b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix and add some notes to the cells v2 first time setup doc

There was a typo in here about the map_cell0 command creating
a db connection with a _nova suffix when it's actually a _cell0
suffix like in the example, nova_cell0.

This also adds a reminder to sync the API database schema before
running the commands and also gives a warning about being
specific when using map_cell0 and having the databases on different
hosts.

Depends-On: I541b072638b5d50985145391e76f610417fdcaa6

subject: Introduce userspace group_vars and host_vars
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 17:22:34.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/openstack-ansible.rc'], 'message': 'Introduce userspace group_vars and host_vars

This opens the door to using group_vars and host_vars in
userspace, by allowing the user to define a ":" delimited list
of folder that will then be used by a vars_plugin, and (maybe
later) by the inventory.

This can't override group_vars due to ansible precedence.
We could technically have this override done by moving the
group_vars into a different folder and adding it to these
environment variables.

Change-Id: Ib2cbb35c0a7bccd896fbe71c22eeb07188db99ee
(cherry picked from commit 2377479d9bcc305f26040fabcc1d26d7f8b01915)
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce userspace group_vars and host_vars

This opens the door to using group_vars and host_vars in
userspace, by allowing the user to define a ":" delimited list
of folder that will then be used by a vars_plugin, and (maybe
later) by the inventory.

This can't override group_vars due to ansible precedence.
We could technically have this override done by moving the
group_vars into a different folder and adding it to these
environment variables.

Change-Id: Ib2cbb35c0a7bccd896fbe71c22eeb07188db99ee
(cherry picked from commit 2377479d9bcc305f26040fabcc1d26d7f8b01915)

subject: Add mkfs.vfat to nova-compute source images
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-15 00:51:44.000000000', 'files': ['docker/nova/nova-compute/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Add mkfs.vfat to nova-compute source images

Currently Windows and non-declared os_type images (defaults
to Windows) attempt to format ephemeral volumes with
mkfs.vfat but fail as this tool is not available in the
container.

This is resolved by installing dosfstools on the Source
builds (as I believe this is handled in binary builds
through dependencies).

Change-Id: Iefa5fb0a16eed30aea935268f2a9becb1481b018
Closes-bug: #1672199
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>
(cherry picked from commit 76cae7fe0bb4cfef0fbd1eb232098e7b1e6775eb)
'}]
commit_message:
Add mkfs.vfat to nova-compute source images

Currently Windows and non-declared os_type images (defaults
to Windows) attempt to format ephemeral volumes with
mkfs.vfat but fail as this tool is not available in the
container.

This is resolved by installing dosfstools on the Source
builds (as I believe this is handled in binary builds
through dependencies).

Change-Id: Iefa5fb0a16eed30aea935268f2a9becb1481b018
Closes-bug: #1672199
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>
(cherry picked from commit 76cae7fe0bb4cfef0fbd1eb232098e7b1e6775eb)

subject: Add support for mail servers that require a login
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-08 06:26:33.000000000', 'files': ['releasetools/cmds/mail.py'], 'message': 'Add support for mail servers that require a login

When running announce.sh from my local developer workstation I cannot
connect to lisst.openstack.org.  I know my ISP filters outbound traffic
to port TCP:25 but there may be additional reasons.

This chnage enhances the --server option to allow you to provide
username, password hostname and TCP port with which to contact a mail
server.

This is not a complete solution but it makes it much easier for me to
work locally if needed.

Change-Id: I1a0f03341d1962a30c0737b59d32e8e68c28644b
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for mail servers that require a login

When running announce.sh from my local developer workstation I cannot
connect to lisst.openstack.org.  I know my ISP filters outbound traffic
to port TCP:25 but there may be additional reasons.

This chnage enhances the --server option to allow you to provide
username, password hostname and TCP port with which to contact a mail
server.

This is not a complete solution but it makes it much easier for me to
work locally if needed.

Change-Id: I1a0f03341d1962a30c0737b59d32e8e68c28644b

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-14 16:53:59.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/keystone.yaml'], 'message': "keystone/containers: Add support for fernet keys

Since the 'file' resource is included in the tags that puppet takes into
account, we already generate the fernet keys if it's enabled as a token
provider.

This merely adds the keys to the container. However, if fernet is not
the provider, we make this file addition optional.

Change-Id: Id92039b3bad9ecda169323e01de7bebae70f2ba0
"}]
commit_message:
keystone/containers: Add support for fernet keys

Since the 'file' resource is included in the tags that puppet takes into
account, we already generate the fernet keys if it's enabled as a token
provider.

This merely adds the keys to the container. However, if fernet is not
the provider, we make this file addition optional.

Change-Id: Id92039b3bad9ecda169323e01de7bebae70f2ba0

- remove instace:* meter references, that was dropped in liberty
- collapse all references to icehouse/kilo/liberty into
  'mitaka release or earlier'

- unmark storage.* measures as deprecated, because they aren't.
- instance, image, volume, snapshot meters removed in Ocata
- all networking existence and CRUD 'meters' removed in Ocata
- only identity.authenticate.* meters kept as of ocata.
- heat meters removed in Ocata
- sahara meters removed in Ocata

- energy meters removed in pike

Change-Id: I372d988b75f8d0bd65c72b362463116e6abb62af
Closes-Bug: #1457440
"}]
commit_message:
cleanup telemetry measurements

- remove instace:* meter references, that was dropped in liberty
- collapse all references to icehouse/kilo/liberty into
  'mitaka release or earlier'
- add note regarding libvirt version req for RBD-backed storage.
- unmark storage.* measures as deprecated, because they aren't.
- instance, image, volume, snapshot meters removed in Ocata
- all networking existence and CRUD 'meters' removed in Ocata
- only identity.authenticate.* meters kept as of ocata.
- heat meters removed in Ocata
- sahara meters removed in Ocata
- magnetodb meters removed in Newton
- energy meters removed in pike

Change-Id: I372d988b75f8d0bd65c72b362463116e6abb62af
Closes-Bug: #1457440

subject: Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load() for governance
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-10 01:05:32.000000000', 'files': ['tools/teamstats.py', 'tools/validate_tags.py', 'doc/source/_exts/projects.py'], 'message': 'Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load() for governance

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Icf559f9c8b37c6f564c820fde79c85a77ba4f839
'}]
commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load() for governance

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Icf559f9c8b37c6f564c820fde79c85a77ba4f839

commit_message:
Listing all types of supported tokens

Adding description about all tokens : UUID, PKI, PKIZ
and fernet with the pros and cons of using them.

commit_message:
Deployment Guide

This builds the deployment guide that will be published to
https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/ocata/.

In this approach, all existing documents in kolla-ansible/doc directory
will remain. The kolla-ansible/deploy-guide directory will simply
include all documents that exist in the kolla-ansible/doc directory.
All new changes will be made to the documents in the docs directory
which will be imported to the deployment-guide. However, I believe we
will also have to build the deployment-guide every time a change is
merged to the docs in the doc directory.

Change-Id: I98db4ec45403cf48086381b45bf5a12bbf998911
(cherry picked from commit 78cf8abd1b193aa8a904bbbb49ce2bdee7c5af6f)

commit_message:
Improve database object access checking

When Mistral is configured with 'auth_enable=True', we need to check
the resource accessbility when operating db resources (i.e. resource
RBAC). Such code logic will spread across the db layer. The patch move
these logic to on single place.

Change-Id: Ia8509986c18b63ef4b338f1dffb935f3fed5ad06

subject: Introduce test case with class cleanups
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-11 23:14:32.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/test_discover/test_discover.py', 'tempest/lib/suite.py', 'tempest/tests/lib/test_test.py', 'tempest/tests/lib/fake_fixtures.py', 'tempest/hacking/checks.py', 'tempest/lib/test.py'], 'message': 'Introduce test case with class cleanups

Tempest has a common use case of resources that are setup
at setUpClass time - and thus shared by all tests in the
TestSuite associated to the test class, and which needs to
be cleaned up after all tests in the suite are executed.

We want to implement the resource providers as fixtures,
but we need the ability to schedule a the cleanup of the
fixtures in a safe way, so that it will always happen no
matter what.

This is achieved by implementing a new test base class,
which overrides setUpClass and tearDownClass fixtures,
and implementing an addClassCleanup method.
Any failure during cleanup of the fixtures will be
recorded and raised as MultipleExceptions along with
any failure triggered by class level fixtures.

A new useClassFixture method is exposed as well, which
allows using a fixture from setUpClass in tests.

WIP!! Test coverage missing.

Partially-implements: bp tempest-stable-fixtures

Change-Id: I5d4f0477893432a84ba98d8a596a6d6d0fc9a7a0
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce test case with class cleanups

Tempest has a common use case of resources that are setup
at setUpClass time - and thus shared by all tests in the
TestSuite associated to the test class, and which needs to
be cleaned up after all tests in the suite are executed.

We want to implement the resource providers as fixtures,
but we need the ability to schedule a the cleanup of the
fixtures in a safe way, so that it will always happen no
matter what.

This is achieved by implementing a new test base class,
which overrides setUpClass and tearDownClass fixtures,
and implementing an addClassCleanup method.
Any failure during cleanup of the fixtures will be
recorded and raised as MultipleExceptions along with
any failure triggered by class level fixtures.

A new useClassFixture method is exposed as well, which
allows using a fixture from setUpClass in tests.

WIP!! Test coverage missing.

Partially-implements: bp tempest-stable-fixtures

Change-Id: I5d4f0477893432a84ba98d8a596a6d6d0fc9a7a0

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-08 10:32:28.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/subnets/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/security_groups/tables.py', 'doc/source/topics/settings.rst', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/key_pairs/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/floating_ips/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/floating_ips/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example'], 'message': "Make button quota check configurable

Horizon will do quota check when displaying a creation button (e.g.
'Launch Instance'), which will get all openstack resources quota and
usage, calling openstack apis in sequence, the page loading is slowed
down as a result.

This patch adds an config option 'OPENSTACK_BUTTON_QUOTA_CHECK', it
is up to deployer to enable/disable it. Setting it to False will show
the button even when quota will be exceeded, leaving it to api for
quota check, which will improve the page loading performance
significantly.

The reason that I didn't put the check in a common place (in
'tenant_quota_usages' method) is because the method will be called in
other places that quota usage is needed.

Change-Id: If83d6e9a48610bbcc1dea533b4c472519705aade
Closes-Bug: #1662347
"}]
commit_message:
Make button quota check configurable

Horizon will do quota check when displaying a creation button (e.g.
'Launch Instance'), which will get all openstack resources quota and
usage, calling openstack apis in sequence, the page loading is slowed
down as a result.

This patch adds an config option 'OPENSTACK_BUTTON_QUOTA_CHECK', it
is up to deployer to enable/disable it. Setting it to False will show
the button even when quota will be exceeded, leaving it to api for
quota check, which will improve the page loading performance
significantly.

The reason that I didn't put the check in a common place (in
'tenant_quota_usages' method) is because the method will be called in
other places that quota usage is needed.

Change-Id: If83d6e9a48610bbcc1dea533b4c472519705aade
Closes-Bug: #1662347

commit_message:
NG details view route should not be '/project/...'

Right now the route includes the name 'project'
but we may have details view for 'identity' and
'admin' too, so it should be more general.

Picked just 'ngdetails' instead and moved this out as a
constant. Since this constant needs to be used
by the config blocks, I moved it out into its own
constant module.

Change-Id: I7603250dd70eb40568aa74be2ae4821ee8fcefcc
Closes-Bug: #1641250

This simplifies test code a bit. Previously, we introduced the

commit_message:
Untangle WaitTimeout class from eventlet.TimeoutError

This simplifies test code a bit. Previously, we introduced the
WaitTimeout class to replace the eventlet.TimeoutError that inherited
from BaseException and hence could interrupt normal test worker run.

Now that we were initiating deprecation warning messages for a cycle
when the user relied on eventlet.TimeoutError, we should be ok to remove
the parent class from the list of inheritance for WaitTimeout.

Change-Id: I6160cc1408f72a9f847a59702bc74b8e52a10497
