subject: Add a stub CredentialProviderFactory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-22 14:48:58.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/common/cred_provider.py'], 'message': "Add a stub CredentialProviderFactory

CredentialProviderFactory exposes a very simple interface for tests
to obtain a credential provider:
- default which works for most tests
- forcing dynamic which is required for quota tests or similar
- forcing preprovisioned which is provided mostly for completness
- forcing an identity version which is used by identity tests

The factory is a singleton, so that it's configuration can be
provider by the config module when it's loaded, without this
module depending from config.py directly. The factory will become
part of the stable interface, and it can be used in conjunction
with the config module or as standalone.

The plumbing to get config values in is not implemented yet,
and thus the factory only returns stub credential providers,
for PoC purposes.

Change-Id: I714d082c80a952b9528c07ff8599b5b31ff2a0fa
"}]
commit_message:
Add a stub CredentialProviderFactory

CredentialProviderFactory exposes a very simple interface for tests
to obtain a credential provider:
- default which works for most tests
- forcing dynamic which is required for quota tests or similar
- forcing preprovisioned which is provided mostly for completness
- forcing an identity version which is used by identity tests

The factory is a singleton, so that it's configuration can be
provider by the config module when it's loaded, without this
module depending from config.py directly. The factory will become
part of the stable interface, and it can be used in conjunction
with the config module or as standalone.

The plumbing to get config values in is not implemented yet,
and thus the factory only returns stub credential providers,
for PoC purposes.

Change-Id: I714d082c80a952b9528c07ff8599b5b31ff2a0fa

subject: Introduce resourced test cases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-22 14:48:58.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tempest/test.py'], 'message': 'Introduce resourced test cases

Tempest tests use a combination of class and test level fixtures
to setup test resources. Resources defined at class level are
typically re-used by all tests in the test class. Conversely
resources created during test fixtures (or test method) are
destroyed one the test is finished.

Common resources are:
- test credentials and associated networks
- test servers
- ssh validation resources (keypair, security groups, IPs)

The existing codebase grew rather organically, without a
clear direction in terms of resource allocation, so the current
code base contains a combination of different approaches for
managing resources, which are also copy pasted in new Tempest
code and plugins, making the code hard to read, debug and
maintain.

One possible solution is to use testresources, and ditch
class level resources for good. A resource manager object
would become responsible for making sure that resources are
re-used in a similar way as they are today.
The resource managers could then be defined as stable
interfaces in the tempest.lib space, and re-used by plugins.

The current setUpClass performs a number of steps, all of
which would have to be moved somewhere else:
- skip_checks: can be moved as-is in setUp
- setup_credentials: this would become a resource manager
- setup_clients: aliasing of clients is a bit confusing as
  it is today, since clients are aliased and re-aliased.
  This can be done in setUp initially, and it would have
  to be solved eventually
- resource_setup: this would be managed by resource mgrs

The main reason why this was not done yet, is that it is
likely to create a lot of churn in the codebase, for an
unclear benefit. The current code base already provides
a mechanism to allocate resources by setting class
attributes, but that mechanism has turned out to be
hard to debug, and testresources would not provide a
huge benefit in that direction either.

The main advantage would probably be ditching class level
resources, which create a confusing subunit stream with
skips and errors happening at class level, and also
create inconsistent and sub-optimaal resource usage in
tests, which in a f ew cases lead to race conditions and
issues in the gate.

With this commit I start a PoC on this to get a more
concrete idea of how this would look like and get people
opinion on it, before we decide to continue or stop this
direction for good.

The alternative approach would be to create class level
fixtures, which would provide a common way to handle class
level resources. Class level fixture would also go into
tempest.lib as a stable interface, see:
I5d4f0477893432a84ba98d8a596a6d6d0fc9a7a0

Partially-implements: bp tempest-stable-fixtures
Change-Id: Ic73acaee932b2729a98e46e3b8495f822ed24842
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce resourced test cases

Tempest tests use a combination of class and test level fixtures
to setup test resources. Resources defined at class level are
typically re-used by all tests in the test class. Conversely
resources created during test fixtures (or test method) are
destroyed one the test is finished.

Common resources are:
- test credentials and associated networks
- test servers
- ssh validation resources (keypair, security groups, IPs)

The existing codebase grew rather organically, without a
clear direction in terms of resource allocation, so the current
code base contains a combination of different approaches for
managing resources, which are also copy pasted in new Tempest
code and plugins, making the code hard to read, debug and
maintain.

One possible solution is to use testresources, and ditch
class level resources for good. A resource manager object
would become responsible for making sure that resources are
re-used in a similar way as they are today.
The resource managers could then be defined as stable
interfaces in the tempest.lib space, and re-used by plugins.

The current setUpClass performs a number of steps, all of
which would have to be moved somewhere else:
- skip_checks: can be moved as-is in setUp
- setup_credentials: this would become a resource manager
- setup_clients: aliasing of clients is a bit confusing as
  it is today, since clients are aliased and re-aliased.
  This can be done in setUp initially, and it would have
  to be solved eventually
- resource_setup: this would be managed by resource mgrs

The main reason why this was not done yet, is that it is
likely to create a lot of churn in the codebase, for an
unclear benefit. The current code base already provides
a mechanism to allocate resources by setting class
attributes, but that mechanism has turned out to be
hard to debug, and testresources would not provide a
huge benefit in that direction either.

The main advantage would probably be ditching class level
resources, which create a confusing subunit stream with
skips and errors happening at class level, and also
create inconsistent and sub-optimaal resource usage in
tests, which in a f ew cases lead to race conditions and
issues in the gate.

With this commit I start a PoC on this to get a more
concrete idea of how this would look like and get people
opinion on it, before we decide to continue or stop this
direction for good.

The alternative approach would be to create class level
fixtures, which would provide a common way to handle class
level resources. Class level fixture would also go into
tempest.lib as a stable interface, see:
I5d4f0477893432a84ba98d8a596a6d6d0fc9a7a0

Partially-implements: bp tempest-stable-fixtures
Change-Id: Ic73acaee932b2729a98e46e3b8495f822ed24842

commit_message:
Support new driver configuration options

Allows enabling hardware types in addition to classic drivers.

Also allows providing enabled and default implementations for all
hardware interfaces (not only network one).

Required for TripleO blueprint ironic-driver-composition.
Change-Id: Iaec6c52fcee66dc1bba315dcd6facd902b59d7f5
Related-Bug: #1524745

commit_message:
Adding new repositories for Octavia

The octavia project is adding the following repositories:
  octavia-dashboard
  octavia-tempest-plugin
  python-octaviaclient

This patch sets up those repositories and initial jobs.

octavia-dashboard will be pre-populated with a copy of
neutron-lbaas-dashboard that has the history preserved, but the
branches and tags have been removed.
The other repositories are fresh development and have no code to populate.
They will be setup using cookiecutter.

Change-Id: Id6385b8940fbef6c703db26808cda9607aea360d

commit_message:
Adds minimum common shared code for custom actions API

This patch includes the initial data types, serialization,
string utilities, base exception classes and defines a
base action that includes a context argument.

The mistral_lib.api namespace was also removed in favor of
following the python convention of using an underscore to
denote private methods and considering all other methods
public.

This patch removes code previously added as a placeholder
to match the spec.  As of the Atlanta PTG, the purpose of
this library is now to store common code used within Mistral
ecosystem and 3rd party integration interfaces including
the Custom Actions API and Custom YAQL Functions API.

Change-Id: I77da3cd6eba6c5a9953656d432bc959bd3747ada
Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-custom-actions-api
Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-actions-api-main-entities

commit_message:
[magnum] Replace old jobs with the experimental

Following up the refactoring of magnum jobs.
* Remove the old job builder
* Remove experimental jobs, but keep the k8s-multinode,
  swarm-mode and swarm-ironic in experimental. These three
  are jobs that don't work properly yet and they are
  created to test WIP features.

The result will be having the same voting jobs as before
but using the new builder.

Change-Id: Icdd802fa94a910934bbf2e93ac4c3b5c1b7dec1a

commit_message:
Catch ProjectQuotaNotFound when do update_limit

This is race can occur if a delete action is performed during
create_limit and update_limit, this is acceptable but
we need to catch the ProjectQuotaNotFound and ignore it.

Added a test case for QuotaExists as well.

Closes-Bug: 1552622

Change-Id: I725c3616833e9e328b21d975ab45bdfbd2058be7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 08:13:08.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/nova_compute_utils.py', 'hooks/ceph-access-relation-changed', 'unit_tests/test_nova_compute_hooks.py', 'hooks/nova_compute_hooks.py', 'metadata.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix support for cinder ceph rbd in Ocata

As of Ocata, the ceph key used to access a specific Cinder
Ceph backend must match the name of the key used by cinder,
with an appropriate secret configured for libvirt use with
the cephx key used by the cinder-ceph charm.

Add support for the new ceph-access relation to allow
nova-compute units to communicate with multiple ceph
backends using different cephx keys and user names.

The side effect of this change is that nova-compute will
have a key for use with its own ephemeral backend ceph
access, and a key for each cinder ceph backend configured
in the deployment.

Change-Id: I638473fc46c99a8bfe301f9a0c844de9efd47a2a
Closes-Bug: 1671422
(cherry picked from commit 1467cbb1b3883cfe7c47ac484b2da96d13fa9e13)

commit_message:
Fix support for cinder ceph rbd in Ocata

As of Ocata, the ceph key used to access a specific Cinder
Ceph backend must match the name of the key used by cinder,
with an appropriate secret configured for libvirt use with
the cephx key used by the cinder-ceph charm.

Add support for the new ceph-access relation to allow
nova-compute units to communicate with multiple ceph
backends using different cephx keys and user names.

The side effect of this change is that nova-compute will
have a key for use with its own ephemeral backend ceph
access, and a key for each cinder ceph backend configured
in the deployment.

Change-Id: I638473fc46c99a8bfe301f9a0c844de9efd47a2a
Closes-Bug: 1671422
(cherry picked from commit 1467cbb1b3883cfe7c47ac484b2da96d13fa9e13)

commit_message:
Fix support for cinder ceph rbd on Ocata

As of Ocata, the ceph key used to access a specific Cinder
Ceph backend must match the name of the key used by cinder,
with an appropriate secret configured for libvirt use with
the cephx key used by the cinder-ceph charm.

Add support for the new ceph-access relation to allow
nova-compute units to communicate with multiple ceph
backends using different cephx keys and user names.

The lead cinder-ceph unit will generate a UUID for use in
the cinder configuration file, and for use by the remote
nova-compute units when configuring libvirt secrets,
ensuring that both ends of the integration match up.

The side effect of this change is that nova-compute will
have a key for use with its own ephemeral backend ceph
access, and a key for each cinder ceph backend configured
in the deployment.

Change-Id: I974ecb39132feddfffabd6dcef401e91b5548d05
Closes-Bug: 1671422
(cherry picked from commit 62613456e7a04ac348d4589145a550323dfa5a55)

commit_message:
Add additional release note for cinder-ceph storage

A new relation is required to support key sharing between
the cinder-ceph and nova-compute charms, providing better
support for use of multiple storage backends.

Add a release note to this effect.

Change-Id: Idc32c75593c0ac90b4e2bff1c79d9a4d3486aa95
Closes-Bug: 1671422

subject: Increase tcp_retries2 value
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7109, 'name': 'Dmitry Mescheryakov (dmitryme)', 'email': 'dmescheryakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dmitryme'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 14200, 'name': 'Maksim Malchuk', 'email': 'maksim.malchuk@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmalchuk'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 16771, 'name': 'mpolenchuk', 'email': 'mpolenchuk@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mpolenchuk'}, {'_account_id': 18795, 'name': 'mkarpin', 'email': 'mkarpin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'nkarpin'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-03 16:37:04.000000000', 'files': ['tests/noop/spec/hosts/netconfig/netconfig_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/netconfig/netconfig.pp'], 'message': "Increase tcp_retries2 value

Current value of 5 results in socket operation timeout after ~12.9
seconds. This is a bit too low, e.g. we've seen RabbitMQ network
splits in production.

This 12.9s amount is equal as 0.2*(2^1+2^2+..2^5), where 0.2 is a
retry timeout (RTO) that is calculated by kernel on a per-socket
basis. But in fast local networks it usually almost equal to minimum
values of 0.2s hardcoded in linux kernel (and BTW, RFC says that
minimum value should be 1s).

On the other hand, comment in netconfig.pp says that our target
timeout is ~54 seconds. And changing tcp_retries2 to 7 is consistent
with that comment - tests an live env show that resulting timeout is
~52.2s

Change-Id: Ib52f40ef1017a9da5a29cd62fb744a4597860763
"}]
commit_message:
Increase tcp_retries2 value

Current value of 5 results in socket operation timeout after ~12.9
seconds. This is a bit too low, e.g. we've seen RabbitMQ network
splits in production.

This 12.9s amount is equal as 0.2*(2^1+2^2+..2^5), where 0.2 is a
retry timeout (RTO) that is calculated by kernel on a per-socket
basis. But in fast local networks it usually almost equal to minimum
values of 0.2s hardcoded in linux kernel (and BTW, RFC says that
minimum value should be 1s).

On the other hand, comment in netconfig.pp says that our target
timeout is ~54 seconds. And changing tcp_retries2 to 7 is consistent
with that comment - tests an live env show that resulting timeout is
~52.2s

Change-Id: Ib52f40ef1017a9da5a29cd62fb744a4597860763

commit_message:
K8s Services support: LBaaSv2Driver

This patch adds new LBaaSDriver driver used to support K8s services
and provides LBaaSv2Driver implementation that relies on Neutron
LBaaSv2 API.

NOTE: functionality added by this patch can only be properly
      verified after corresponding handler is added to the controller
      in subsequent patch.

Change-Id: Iaaeec7b6f8357ed1f7efbfcff0972f5349c28fe0
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration

commit_message:
Don't run check-requirements on old branches fro networking-bgppvn

We the check-requirements job was added to the template for
networking-bgppvn it enabled requirements checking on all branches.
Neither the networking-bgpvpn or the requirements repo is setup for this
on older (pre-Ocata) branches.  This is manifesting as updates to
requirements.txt to correct gate issues[1] being blocked by the
check-requirements job[2].

So disable that check job on old branches

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/periodic-networking-bgpvpn-python27-newton/d91cbf9/console.html#_2017-03-01_06_12_03_108318
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/68/439668/2/check/gate-networking-bgpvpn-requirements/89d17d3/console.html#_2017-03-01_17_21_02_404982

Change-Id: I9b8364df78f19ca1f28b42ee24e715ef6abee33f
Needed-By: Ic109c11cbc72da4f206606995be156fc0f664266

commit_message:
Guard against os-log-merger failure

At the moment, the tool may crash parsing some files, which renders the
whole run failed. Until we fix that in the next os-log-merger, just
ignore failures and proceed. Of course, that will mean no -index.txt
file generated, or with incomplete data. Still better than just
invalidating the test run.

Change-Id: I28300de31ed49b1a21e4c1ed1f7d10f90943878b

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-03 11:20:35.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_iscsi.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connectors/iscsi.py'], 'message': 'WIP Handle scsi_id failures when disconnecting iSCSI multipath volumes

Previously failures to lookup the WWN of a volume using scsi_id would
halt any attempt to disconnect an iSCSI multipath volume. Such failures
can occur when cleaning up evacuated instances using such volumes as the
host no longer has access to the volumes and thus scsi_id lookups will
fail.

Falling back to the direct method of querying multipath locally on the
host should allow the disconnect to complete correctly allowing for
instances to be cleaned up and furture volume operations to succeed on
the host.

Change-Id: Iead950a3f461c3d129deceff873f309aa23d4f83
Resolves: #
'}]
commit_message:
WIP Handle scsi_id failures when disconnecting iSCSI multipath volumes

Previously failures to lookup the WWN of a volume using scsi_id would
halt any attempt to disconnect an iSCSI multipath volume. Such failures
can occur when cleaning up evacuated instances using such volumes as the
host no longer has access to the volumes and thus scsi_id lookups will
fail.

Falling back to the direct method of querying multipath locally on the
host should allow the disconnect to complete correctly allowing for
instances to be cleaned up and furture volume operations to succeed on
the host.

Change-Id: Iead950a3f461c3d129deceff873f309aa23d4f83
Resolves: #

[{'number': 20, 'created': '2015-03-09 14:24:08.000000000', 'files': ['etc/trove/conf.d/guest_info.conf', 'trove/common/cfg.py', 'etc/trove/conf.d/guest_info', 'etc/trove/trove-taskmanager.conf.sample', 'trove/tests/unittests/common/test_template.py', 'trove/taskmanager/models.py', 'trove/templates/default.heat.template', 'etc/trove/conf.d/README', 'trove/tests/unittests/taskmanager/test_models.py'], 'message': 'Inject guest conf files to configurable location

Introduce a configuration option for a directory on the guest where the
taskmanager should inject configuration files.

During instance creation inject the guest_info and trove-guestagent
conf files to the 'injected_config_location'. The default location is
/etc/trove/conf.d.

Also:
 - Change the default value for 'guest_config' to remove the risk of
   overwriting a guest image's conf file with the sample.
 - Add trove-guestagent.conf injection to heat template.

Depends-On: I1dffd373da722af55bdea41fead8456bb60c82b2

/etc/guest_info.

Closes-Bug: 1309030
Change-Id: I1057f4a1b6232332ed4b520dbc7b3bbb04145f73'}]
commit_message:
Inject guest conf files to configurable location

Introduce a configuration option for a directory on the guest where the
taskmanager should inject configuration files.

During instance creation inject the guest_info and trove-guestagent
conf files to the 'injected_config_location'. The default location is
/etc/trove/conf.d.

Also:
 - Change the default value for 'guest_config' to remove the risk of
   overwriting a guest image's conf file with the sample.
 - Add trove-guestagent.conf injection to heat template.
 - Add new 'guest_info' option that defaults to "guest_info.conf".

Depends-On: I1dffd373da722af55bdea41fead8456bb60c82b2

Co-Authored-By: Denis Makogon <dmakogon@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Duk Loi <duk@tesora.com>

DocImpact: This change introduces a new option with a default that
affects existing guest images. The guestagent init script for any
existing guest image will need to be modified to read the conf
files from /etc/trove/conf.d.  For backwards compatibility set the
injected_config_location to /etc/trove and guest_info to
/etc/guest_info.

Closes-Bug: 1309030
Change-Id: I1057f4a1b6232332ed4b520dbc7b3bbb04145f73

commit_message:
Reserve migration placeholders for Ocata backports

Normally we reserve five slots for the API database instead of the default
ten. However, given all the stuff that merged in Ocata related to API-level
services, I'm going to reserve ten here just so we have space if we need
it.

Change-Id: I57c2edcf1fb80e24017cb1b4be00065aa20b342c

commit_message:
Add notifications parameters

Add notification_transport_url to configure a URL representing the
messaging driver to use for notifications.
Add notification_driver to configure driver or drivers to handle
sending notifications.

notifications.

commit_message:
Log stack trace if action initialization faild

In executor service we do not log out the stack trace
if there are some error happened during action creation.
It would would be very useful in many cases.

subject: zanata_stat: Require to specify project and version
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-08 05:00:14.000000000', 'files': ['tools/zanata/zanata_stats.py'], 'message': 'zanata_stat: Require to specify project and version

As described in bug 1670640, the current vesion of zanata_stat
only honors stats from a single combination of project and version.
To avoid this situation, this commit forces users to specify
a single branch (Zanata version) and a single project.

A further patch can improve the tool to merge statistics
from all versions and projects.

Change-Id: I806941e264747b8116ff4c0881e26cf890e516a8
Partial-Bug: #1670640
'}]
commit_message:
zanata_stat: Require to specify project and version

As described in bug 1670640, the current vesion of zanata_stat
only honors stats from a single combination of project and version.
To avoid this situation, this commit forces users to specify
a single branch (Zanata version) and a single project.

A further patch can improve the tool to merge statistics
from all versions and projects.

Change-Id: I806941e264747b8116ff4c0881e26cf890e516a8
Partial-Bug: #1670640

Move the grenade multi-node job from the experimental queue to the

commit_message:
ironic: Make grenade multi-node job non-voting

Move the grenade multi-node job from the experimental queue to the
check queue as a non-voting job

Don't run grenade multi-node for: stable/mitaka, stable/newton, or
stable/ocata. As it is being added in the Pike cycle.

Change-Id: Ibc74281a86449c18604cb3e535279afacf532b1c

subject: Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-04 02:59:58.000000000', 'files': ['solumclient/common/yamlutils.py'], 'message': 'Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if
you receive a YAML document from an untrusted source
such as the Internet. The function yaml.safe_load()
limits this ability to simple Python objects like
integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I4e77b80278c33ec9bb5cc78f6ff6829c72c7aa00
'}]
commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if
you receive a YAML document from an untrusted source
such as the Internet. The function yaml.safe_load()
limits this ability to simple Python objects like
integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I4e77b80278c33ec9bb5cc78f6ff6829c72c7aa00

commit_message:

Sometimes order of disks can be changed. So we need
to select disk using type ("qcow2" by default) but
not by index.

Closes-Bug: 1670711

commit_message:
Sahara needs to run ssh-keygen

In order to generate keypair and access to cluster instances,
sahara-base container must include this binary, even when we
deploy based on source type.

Change-Id: I40747bceba3fede66864b781df1da1034ea22d11
Closes-Bug: #1665293

subject: Adds TLS/SSL Version Support to Murano Engine.
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-03-13 16:27:05.000000000', 'files': ['murano/common/config.py', 'murano/tests/unit/common/messaging/test_mqclient.py', 'murano/common/messaging/mqclient.py'], 'message': 'Adds TLS/SSL Version Support to Murano Engine.

Currently, Murano supports enabling SSL in Murano Engine [0],
but does not have a param for the user to specify the
desired SSL version. This is important because some
versions of SSL are less secure than others [1].

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/murano/administrator-guide/deploy_murano/configure_ssl.html
[1] https://www.wolfssl.com/wolfSSL/Blog/Entries/2010/10/7_Differences_between_SSL_and_TLS_Protocol_Versions.html

Change-Id: I71c36c455cde658f402a19c59d7966cee8544cf1
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-tls-support
'}]
commit_message:
Adds TLS/SSL Version Support to Murano Engine.

Currently, Murano supports enabling SSL in Murano Engine [0],
but does not have a param for the user to specify the
desired SSL version. This is important because some
versions of SSL are less secure than others [1].

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/murano/administrator-guide/deploy_murano/configure_ssl.html
[1] https://www.wolfssl.com/wolfSSL/Blog/Entries/2010/10/7_Differences_between_SSL_and_TLS_Protocol_Versions.html

Change-Id: I71c36c455cde658f402a19c59d7966cee8544cf1
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-tls-support

commit_message:
Use base.create_image_from_server to create server snapshot

In I8ee2e18925e7f4f09d10d857fb25f3d9b8e8bd42, SnapshotNotFoundException
is added to base.create_image_from_server to get more friendly
error info, so testcases should use base.create_image_from_server
as far as possible, moreover, the code will look simpler.

Change-Id: I34ae75d56b4243d67a1a9ec48d033b1e7d6356a7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 14:19:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_designer.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_vif.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/designer.py', 'releasenotes/notes/libvirt-script-with-empty-path-2b49caa68b05278d.yaml'], 'message': "libvirt: avoid generating script with empty path

Previously, libvirt just appended 'script=' onto the QEMU cmd line
according to what <script path=''/> contained, letting QEMU execute the
script.  That was flawed from security POV (you don't want QEMU to be
allowed to execute anything), so newer libvirt (as of [1]) executes the
script now.  But the libvirt code doesn't allow this corner case (of
allowing and ignoring an empty script path) whereas apparently the QEMU
code does.

So the Nova setting of '' used to work by accident, but now does not.

[1]
http://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commitdiff;h=9c17d66 (autocreate
tap device for ethernet network type)

Closes-Bug: #1649527
Change-Id: I4f97c05e2dec610af22a5150dd27696e1d767896
(cherry picked from commit 847952927c60ed0577bc835adf607ed7b8f15240)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: avoid generating script with empty path

Previously, libvirt just appended 'script=' onto the QEMU cmd line
according to what <script path=''/> contained, letting QEMU execute the
script.  That was flawed from security POV (you don't want QEMU to be
allowed to execute anything), so newer libvirt (as of [1]) executes the
script now.  But the libvirt code doesn't allow this corner case (of
allowing and ignoring an empty script path) whereas apparently the QEMU
code does.

So the Nova setting of '' used to work by accident, but now does not.

[1]
http://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commitdiff;h=9c17d66 (autocreate
tap device for ethernet network type)

Closes-Bug: #1649527
Change-Id: I4f97c05e2dec610af22a5150dd27696e1d767896
(cherry picked from commit 847952927c60ed0577bc835adf607ed7b8f15240)

subject: Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 07:36:50.000000000', 'files': ['solum/deployer/handlers/heat.py'], 'message': 'Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if
you receive a YAML document from an untrusted source
such as the Internet. The function yaml.safe_load()
limits this ability to simple Python objects like
integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I525565d5d8588b7a1eb6dc75f64d823bd0d9073e
'}]
commit_message:
Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if
you receive a YAML document from an untrusted source
such as the Internet. The function yaml.safe_load()
limits this ability to simple Python objects like
integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I525565d5d8588b7a1eb6dc75f64d823bd0d9073e

commit_message:
Migrate to ostestr framework and PY3

Following commits does several things:

* migrates CI of monasca-common to ostestr
* enables PY35 compatybility

Also:

* marked one tests as excluded under PY35 because changing
it would require affecting embedded kafka library which
will be eventually removed in future

(cherry-picked from commit cabc2ddd5f239e5f44e090d35aaac0770e5849ba)

Change-Id: I432a466e2620bc8d305ef2630307b636461c8e81

commit_message:
Support creating network with pool uuid

Right now, we can create network with pool name, but it doesn't
work well if there are two subnetpools with the same name. This
commit add support for pool uuid as an alternative.

Implements: blueprint existing-subnetpool
Closes-Bug: #1659434
Change-Id: Ib7c2bac86a1b1647c2da9684bc4317767116d7aa

subject: Update to a newer hacking library
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 02:11:00.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Update to a newer hacking library

The older hacking library has a cap on pbr <2.0, with the recent 2.0.0
release of PBR it's causing failures in the pep8 job. hacking isn't kept
in sync via the typical proposal-bot updates. Do it manually to clear the
gate issue.

Change-Id: I48fd7bb309bef6406e190a774e13f5c930355ba9
"}]
commit_message:
Update to a newer hacking library

The older hacking library has a cap on pbr <2.0, with the recent 2.0.0
release of PBR it's causing failures in the pep8 job. hacking isn't kept
in sync via the typical proposal-bot updates. Do it manually to clear the
gate issue.

Change-Id: I48fd7bb309bef6406e190a774e13f5c930355ba9

subject: we now need to have dib installed explicitly
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-10 13:14:51.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'integration/scripts/trovestack.rc', 'integration/scripts/functions_qemu', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "we now need to have dib installed explicitly

dib is now going to have to be installed explicitly for us to actually
run the gate. the old method of just cloning the repo won't work with
dib v2.

There are other ways to accomplish this but I'm choosing this approach
knowing that it isn't ideal. First, what's the downside? This means
that dib gets installed wherever trove control plane is installed. Is
that necessary, NO. Is it the end of the world, NO.

What are the options?

- do what Octavia did and have a second requirements.txt in a folder
  called diskimage-create. Would this work, yes but we don't have such
  a mechanism right now and nothing would keep this requirements.txt
  file in sync with g-r that I know of.

- hardcode the pip install command somewhere in the devstack
  plugin. yes, this would work but this would also have no ability to
  sync with g-r.

So, while the solution proposed here isn't ideal, it strikes me as not
bad, and much less risk than the other two options.

We also need to figure out where the elements are and fix the path for
disk-image-create.

Some pep8 failures appears to have crept in as well, those are
addressed.

Change-Id: Ic64d91e082102057417995a0f6851d03b9e0ca74
"}]
commit_message:
we now need to have dib installed explicitly

dib is now going to have to be installed explicitly for us to actually
run the gate. the old method of just cloning the repo won't work with
dib v2.

There are other ways to accomplish this but I'm choosing this approach
knowing that it isn't ideal. First, what's the downside? This means
that dib gets installed wherever trove control plane is installed. Is
that necessary, NO. Is it the end of the world, NO.

What are the options?

- do what Octavia did and have a second requirements.txt in a folder
  called diskimage-create. Would this work, yes but we don't have such
  a mechanism right now and nothing would keep this requirements.txt
  file in sync with g-r that I know of.

- hardcode the pip install command somewhere in the devstack
  plugin. yes, this would work but this would also have no ability to
  sync with g-r.

So, while the solution proposed here isn't ideal, it strikes me as not
bad, and much less risk than the other two options.

We also need to figure out where the elements are and fix the path for
disk-image-create.

Some pep8 failures appears to have crept in as well, those are
addressed.

Change-Id: Ic64d91e082102057417995a0f6851d03b9e0ca74

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Idc263504b68bc909fe7c6cd983c27c1fcc384c16

commit_message:
Make compute/api instance get set target cell on context

Some of the apis use common.get_instance() which calls compute/api
get(). This makes that also set_target_cell() on the context like
the internal-to-servers utility method before. Now things like
server delete will work with cells.

Change-Id: I72e33b00577f53039a2d3caa4f9e716898b7f713

commit_message:
Remove vmware-nsxlib from the global requirements

At the moment we have too much churn in the library. This is
causing too many changes and breaking too many things.

We have decided that the best approach for the short term is
to work in a 1:1 relation ship with the current openstack version
and when the library is more stable return to the model where we
can consume a specific version.

Conflicts:
	global-requirements.txt
	upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I2d845ef41402efa6545fd9c4432a005ab7bb7b89
(cherry picked from commit 34568342ce37586cff9fe3fe462d3e722a4d4c04)

commit_message:
objects: add new field cpuset_reserved in NUMACell

NUMA nodes should store the pCPUs reserved for the hypervisor
to allow drivers to use them and allow to compute NUMA topology
resources usage.

implements blueprint libvirt-emulator-threads-policy

Change-Id: Ieec2e698d6ca8ce4257e0db2f21e3021b3d7d479

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 13:44:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Remove redundant bdm serial mangling and saving during swap_volume

During an initial swap_volume call the serial of the original volume was
previously stashed in the connection_info of the new volume by the
compute layer. This was used by I19d5182d11 to allow the virt driver to
lookup and update the existing BDM with the new volume's connection_info
after it had been used by connect_volume.

Future calls to swap_volume in the compute layer would not
update the serial found in the old volume connection_info. This would
result in an invalid serial being copied into the new volume
connection_info and used to preform a lookup of a BDM that didn't exist.

To correct this we now explicitly set the serial of the new volume to
that of the new volume id. While the correct serial id should already be
present in the connection_info provided by most backend Cinder volume
drivers the act of updating this dict is required by our own functional
tests to invoke a failure case :

https://git.io/vDmRE

The serial is updated once more to match the volume id returned
by os-migrate-volume-completion prior to the BDM being updated in the
compute layer.

The BDM lookup and save from the virt layer is also removed as the
compute layer retains a reference to new_cinfo and will update the BDM
with this, including any modifications, at the end of swap_volume.

Finally, the associated Tempest admin test is also extended by the
following change to now attempt a second volume swap to verify these
changes :

I2a2c80a164b9f75d0e7e0503a24194bedfc0e66b

Conflicts:
        nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Simple conflict caused by I90d4ffcb adding an error
notification for swap_volume.

Closes-bug: #1661016
Change-Id: If74dd9d8e7191047b6f1cd7e35b6fc667f004f91
(cherry picked from commit 1bf7ac804808eb0d4a68847e466f5fa7d1dcd55e)
(cherry picked from commit 4bf211c617814d46d590bb7b11806170f5c19484)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Remove redundant bdm serial mangling and saving during swap_volume

During an initial swap_volume call the serial of the original volume was
previously stashed in the connection_info of the new volume by the
compute layer. This was used by I19d5182d11 to allow the virt driver to
lookup and update the existing BDM with the new volume's connection_info
after it had been used by connect_volume.

Future calls to swap_volume in the compute layer would not
update the serial found in the old volume connection_info. This would
result in an invalid serial being copied into the new volume
connection_info and used to preform a lookup of a BDM that didn't exist.

To correct this we now explicitly set the serial of the new volume to
that of the new volume id. While the correct serial id should already be
present in the connection_info provided by most backend Cinder volume
drivers the act of updating this dict is required by our own functional
tests to invoke a failure case :

https://git.io/vDmRE

The serial is updated once more to match the volume id returned
by os-migrate-volume-completion prior to the BDM being updated in the
compute layer.

The BDM lookup and save from the virt layer is also removed as the
compute layer retains a reference to new_cinfo and will update the BDM
with this, including any modifications, at the end of swap_volume.

Finally, the associated Tempest admin test is also extended by the
following change to now attempt a second volume swap to verify these
changes :

I2a2c80a164b9f75d0e7e0503a24194bedfc0e66b

Conflicts:
        nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Simple conflict caused by I90d4ffcb adding an error
notification for swap_volume.

Closes-bug: #1661016
Change-Id: If74dd9d8e7191047b6f1cd7e35b6fc667f004f91
(cherry picked from commit 1bf7ac804808eb0d4a68847e466f5fa7d1dcd55e)
(cherry picked from commit 4bf211c617814d46d590bb7b11806170f5c19484)

commit_message:
Add bindep support

Bindep is an automation tool used by openstack-infra to bootstrap a
worker with default packages. This is not needed, since we depend on
puppet to automate this step.

Change-Id: I7d27d72f249c211a25ca3ab208d6d4babe87f4dc

subject: Add betamax-matchers to global-requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-13 12:24:33.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Add betamax-matchers to global-requirements

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes, I maintain it. I use it for my own projects and there are others
  who also use and help maintain it (outside the OpenStack bubble).

- Is the library good code?

  We test thoroughly and use continuous integration services to ensure
  backwards compatibility.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes

- Is the library license compatible?

  Yes - It is released under Apache 2.0

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Ubuntu: No
  Fedora: No
  SUSE:   No
  Gentoo: No, but the search doesn't indicate they package
          python-betamax either which the other three package.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  No. This provides additional matchers for betamax and nothing else
  does that.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  openstack/python-cratonclient needs this library for testing. The
  change that depends on this is:
  Ib69d825a50a7e4179aefd11bcbfbed39c27c7fbe

Change-Id: I45de545b040d2b99ac8f3f4d3c81359615d328e8
"}]
commit_message:
Add betamax-matchers to global-requirements

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes, I maintain it. I use it for my own projects and there are others
  who also use and help maintain it (outside the OpenStack bubble).

- Is the library good code?

  We test thoroughly and use continuous integration services to ensure
  backwards compatibility.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes

- Is the library license compatible?

  Yes - It is released under Apache 2.0

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Ubuntu: No
  Fedora: No
  SUSE:   No
  Gentoo: No, but the search doesn't indicate they package
          python-betamax either which the other three package.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  No. This provides additional matchers for betamax and nothing else
  does that.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  openstack/python-cratonclient needs this library for testing. The
  change that depends on this is:
  Ib69d825a50a7e4179aefd11bcbfbed39c27c7fbe

Change-Id: I45de545b040d2b99ac8f3f4d3c81359615d328e8

commit_message:
Use public and unified method get_console_url()

Novaclient has provided a public and unified method
get_console_url() to get console urls of server.
This change switches to use it.

Change-Id: I506fb3752872f3769f53ce4a004889481edfa1b7
Closes-Bug: #1654508

subject: Refactor journal main loop
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-14 12:52:40.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/journal/journal.py'], 'message': "Refactor journal main loop

Some refactoring of the journal's main loop:
* Improve logging - Clearer messages, less log flood
* Terminology - Use 'entry' not 'row' since we're logically dealing with
  entries
* Removed some unhelpful comments
* General code improvements for easier code

Change-Id: I3049ba91bf1908a1104fdbdf3b81bcf8ac3dfffe
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor journal main loop

Some refactoring of the journal's main loop:
* Improve logging - Clearer messages, less log flood
* Terminology - Use 'entry' not 'row' since we're logically dealing with
  entries
* Removed some unhelpful comments
* General code improvements for easier code

Change-Id: I3049ba91bf1908a1104fdbdf3b81bcf8ac3dfffe

commit_message:
Eager load event's resource prop. data when appropiate

Eager load an event's resource properties data in the list_events
"show event" case, i.e. when an event uuid is specified. When showing
multiple events, the events' resource properties data should not be
eager loaded.

Change-Id: I12e371dcbdae398360e28200e68f4a75831f8f17
Closes-bug: #1665506

commit_message:
Test for kube config

The current script blindly overwrites a user's config. It's simple
to test for it. Persumably, a user with a valid ~/.kube/config
would not need to have this overwritten.

Change-Id: I3bb9176b42fabe8139fb1a5ad8745deea649f353

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-27 12:01:13.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/notifiers/nova.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/notifiers/test_nova.py'], 'message': "Remove baremetal notification from nova notifier

This is a revert of change I3d53bff8278dabafd929ecbea0b4b3b441c9e1cf

The nova notifier was updated to notify nova on ports with the
baremetal: device_owner, these ports are owned by Ironic not Nova, so
nova is getting notifications that it doesn't understand.

Change-Id: I8318a682163f6a5b739be68ce56973c43d0e32f2
Closes-Bug: #1656010
Depends-On: I43c3af9f424a65211ef5a39f13e4810072997339
"}]
commit_message:
Remove baremetal notification from nova notifier

This is a revert of change I3d53bff8278dabafd929ecbea0b4b3b441c9e1cf

The nova notifier was updated to notify nova on ports with the
baremetal: device_owner, these ports are owned by Ironic not Nova, so
nova is getting notifications that it doesn't understand.

Change-Id: I8318a682163f6a5b739be68ce56973c43d0e32f2
Closes-Bug: #1656010
Depends-On: I43c3af9f424a65211ef5a39f13e4810072997339

nevertheless made devstack to set those in the past; now I propose to
clean the code from neutron tree and leave it up to deployment tools to

commit_message:
iptables: stop 'fixing' kernel sysctl bridge firewalling knobs

Those are different on different kernel versions, and have reasonable
default values on all newer kernel versions, including RHEL. We
nevertheless made devstack to set those in the past; now I propose to
clean the code from neutron tree and leave it up to deployment tools to
fix in an unlikely case the system has broken default values.

Now that iptables firewall code does not trigger sysctl, we can also
remove this filter from the corresponding rootwrap .filters file.

DocImpact make sure deployment docs mention the expected sysctl knob
          values.

Change-Id: Iabf61021c90b0536be274463d48fb5a572ecc023
Related-Bug: #1622914

subject: Disable process monitor for keepalived test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-09 15:55:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/sanity/checks.py'], 'message': 'Disable process monitor for keepalived test

There was an existing attempt to disable process monitoring, but
since the AGENT.check_child_processes_interval defaults to 60 and
is checked in ProcessMonitor.__init__, overriding the config value
after instantiating the ProcessMonitor only has the affect of
making the check happen continually as quickly as possible instead
of not at all. Instead, we instantiate the process monitor after
changing the config value.

Change-Id: Ic4907b6a227c6fa8288c9d3e2106da0b53323509
Closes-Bug: #1665061
(cherry picked from commit 0faf1aa49f18e8dcbee6ea8be78f6e918090e0a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Disable process monitor for keepalived test

There was an existing attempt to disable process monitoring, but
since the AGENT.check_child_processes_interval defaults to 60 and
is checked in ProcessMonitor.__init__, overriding the config value
after instantiating the ProcessMonitor only has the affect of
making the check happen continually as quickly as possible instead
of not at all. Instead, we instantiate the process monitor after
changing the config value.

Change-Id: Ic4907b6a227c6fa8288c9d3e2106da0b53323509
Closes-Bug: #1665061
(cherry picked from commit 0faf1aa49f18e8dcbee6ea8be78f6e918090e0a1)

subject: Remove floatingip address ignores ha_state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 14:56:44.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py'], 'message': 'Remove floatingip address ignores ha_state

We both enables router_distributed and l3_ha in server side,
and configures L3 agent node as dvr_snat in compute nodes.
HA router removing floatingip address only in master node,
and dvr local router only remove FIP rule. This will cause
RTNETLINK error if we operates floatingip "associate --> disassociate
--> reassociate".

This patch removes floatingip address whether router's ha_state
is master or backup.
Another solution is adding remove_floating_ip in dvr_edge_router.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py

Change-Id: I2fab45cff786c475d69c5f0cf4e9b71e6bbbe653
Closes-Bug: #1641535
(cherry picked from commit b45fd35e3f4a2aaacc7a22faafd00b7350e4f398)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove floatingip address ignores ha_state

We both enables router_distributed and l3_ha in server side,
and configures L3 agent node as dvr_snat in compute nodes.
HA router removing floatingip address only in master node,
and dvr local router only remove FIP rule. This will cause
RTNETLINK error if we operates floatingip "associate --> disassociate
--> reassociate".

This patch removes floatingip address whether router's ha_state
is master or backup.
Another solution is adding remove_floating_ip in dvr_edge_router.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py

Change-Id: I2fab45cff786c475d69c5f0cf4e9b71e6bbbe653
Closes-Bug: #1641535
(cherry picked from commit b45fd35e3f4a2aaacc7a22faafd00b7350e4f398)

commit_message:
Remove invalid tests-py3 whitelist item

The tests for XenAPI plugins were introduced with change [1].
This change also appended them to the python3 test whitelist,
as the functionality could only be executed on python2.4 environment.
The aforementioned changes were removed with change [2], but
the whitelist item was left behind. This change removes the obsolete
line.

[1] 2aa81e9ef6d04f2fdf1c69e16ceeef156cefedfa
[2] 21149582ff944585fb0a815ebe9515c1ec38eb7f

commit_message:
Fix pod_id length inconsistency in data model

1. What is the problem
Pod_id is a foreign key in cached_endpoints table and resource_routings
table, it references pod_id in pod table but has different length. For
more detailed information, please see the bug at the bottom.

2. What is the solution for the problem
Change pod_id length in cached_endpoints table and resource_routings
table. For these two tables in migration scripts we use script to
alter the pod_id length.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
None.

Change-Id: I5ccfc2b72bcac2793c0901fd90c78edce181c074
Closes-Bug: #1670228

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2017-02-10 12:10:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/migration.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_migration.py', 'nova/conf/libvirt.py', 'releasenotes/notes/deprecate-live-migration-downtime-steps-0d4254d529398666.yaml'], 'message': 'WIP: Make it easier to avoid live-migration timeouts

If you are having live-migrations timeout, and you want to avoid that
happening, the key configuration options to consider now are:

* live_migration_downtime
* live_migration_completion_timeout

Where live_migration_downtime tunes how much guest downtime you are
willing to tolerate during the live-migration and
live_migration_completion_timeout defines how long you are willing to
wait for a 1GB ram (with no storage to move) to have a small enough
amount of memory to copy that it can happen in under
live_migration_downtime seconds.

After this change, by default, we spend half of the completion_timeout
time ramping up to the max downtime defined in live_migration_downtime.
This means we try and avoid guest downtime, but take a little longer.

If you want to avoid this ramp up, and start with
live_migration_downtime as the max downtime straight away, then set
live_migration_time_to_max_downtime = 0

You can use live_migration_time_to_max_downtime to decide how fast or
slow to ramp up the max guest downtime, but usually you should be able
to get what you want without having to consider that configuration
setting.

live_migration_time_to_max_downtime is replacing
live_migration_downtime_steps and live_migration_downtime_delay.
The single configuration more closely matches how deployers should be
thinking about this problem.

Change-Id: I88b115ccfa00c2b4465302ad25799b37c3124c29
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Make it easier to avoid live-migration timeouts

If you are having live-migrations timeout, and you want to avoid that
happening, the key configuration options to consider now are:

* live_migration_downtime
* live_migration_completion_timeout

Where live_migration_downtime tunes how much guest downtime you are
willing to tolerate during the live-migration and
live_migration_completion_timeout defines how long you are willing to
wait for a 1GB ram (with no storage to move) to have a small enough
amount of memory to copy that it can happen in under
live_migration_downtime seconds.

After this change, by default, we spend half of the completion_timeout
time ramping up to the max downtime defined in live_migration_downtime.
This means we try and avoid guest downtime, but take a little longer.

If you want to avoid this ramp up, and start with
live_migration_downtime as the max downtime straight away, then set
live_migration_time_to_max_downtime = 0

You can use live_migration_time_to_max_downtime to decide how fast or
slow to ramp up the max guest downtime, but usually you should be able
to get what you want without having to consider that configuration
setting.

live_migration_time_to_max_downtime is replacing
live_migration_downtime_steps and live_migration_downtime_delay.
The single configuration more closely matches how deployers should be
thinking about this problem.

Change-Id: I88b115ccfa00c2b4465302ad25799b37c3124c29

commit_message:
Remove old comment referencing fixed bug

There was an old comment left regarding this bug:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/pbr/+bug/1260495

which was fixed over a year ago but left over.

This change removes the comment and related extension
and adds the referenced pbr setting.

Change-Id: Ib334c136835a9b5b43cabe13b9616cce45e578e0

commit_message:
Remove references of V1 driver

As v1 has been deprecated in Pike and v2 driver is to be used by
default, the documented references to v1 need to be removed.

Change-Id: I8d03f0dd3c5423590cc84ff9ce1e27c5edc001a8
Partially-Implements: blueprint documentation
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-odl/+spec/documentation

commit_message:
Decouple hook and func registration from CommonDbMixin

Move the model query hook registration and resource extend funcs
registration methods out of the CommonDbMixin class and make them
regular utility functions.

This is a step in refactoring the CommonDbMixin class.

Change-Id: Iec1bb7f7098c83640ae695fd7cf2f4736f414ad2

subject: Change Spark version to 1.6.3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-14 21:31:53.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/files/spark/start-spark-worker.sh', 'devstack/files/spark/start-spark-master.sh', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/files/monasca-transform/monasca-transform.conf', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Change Spark version to 1.6.3

We have seen several instances where Spark 1.6.1 over time
continues to consume more and more resources.

The change Ibf244cbfc00a90ada66f492b473719c25fa17fd2 was not
enough alone to curb this growth, but the new version of Spark
has shown better behavior.

Related changes will also need to be done in any installer,
such as Ansible.

Change-Id: Ib6b1220cf0186def115846c8cf71684bb2d6e8c7
'}]
commit_message:
Change Spark version to 1.6.3

We have seen several instances where Spark 1.6.1 over time
continues to consume more and more resources.

The change Ibf244cbfc00a90ada66f492b473719c25fa17fd2 was not
enough alone to curb this growth, but the new version of Spark
has shown better behavior.

Related changes will also need to be done in any installer,
such as Ansible.

Change-Id: Ib6b1220cf0186def115846c8cf71684bb2d6e8c7

commit_message:
Add Delete Container Force action

This patch adds "Delete Container Forcely" action for each containers.
This action is too dangerous for batch action, so implemented as only
item action.

Change-Id: Id839f2ce4beb17d7c4280cecf31b29e63f59197f

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-14 23:28:10.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/lib/osbash/netboot/preseed-ssh-v6.cfg', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/netboot/preseed-all-v6.cfg', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/netboot/preseed-vbadd-v6.cfg'], 'message': 'New preseed files for Ubuntu 16.04.2

With Ubuntu 16.04.2, passing "minimal" to "tasksel/first" causes an
error.

The new preseed files use "standard system utilities" instead.

Fixing the existing files instead of creating new ones would fix
existing 16.04 installations that will keep pointing to the old
preseed files, but it might break 14.04 installations with no
way of fixing them.

Therefore, leaving the old preseed files for 14.04 based installations
and creating new ones for 16.04 based is the safer choice.

Note that this means we have to fix the preseed names in the Newton
branch.

Change-Id: I113c2adaecc79c54677c329aff4e5c3e2e0b3987
'}]
commit_message:
New preseed files for Ubuntu 16.04.2

With Ubuntu 16.04.2, passing "minimal" to "tasksel/first" causes an
error.

The new preseed files use "standard system utilities" instead.

Fixing the existing files instead of creating new ones would fix
existing 16.04 installations that will keep pointing to the old
preseed files, but it might break 14.04 installations with no
way of fixing them.

Therefore, leaving the old preseed files for 14.04 based installations
and creating new ones for 16.04 based is the safer choice.

Note that this means we have to fix the preseed names in the Newton
branch.

Change-Id: I113c2adaecc79c54677c329aff4e5c3e2e0b3987

commit_message:
Sahara needs to run ssh-keygen

In order to generate keypair and access to cluster instances,
sahara-base container must include this binary, even when we
deploy based on source type.

Change-Id: I40747bceba3fede66864b781df1da1034ea22d11
Closes-Bug: #1665293
(cherry picked from commit a614a43bebf51aa63de10dfebfa342dc8d44f491)

subject: Fix openrc on zsh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 19:48:25.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/config/demo-openstackrc.sh', 'labs/osbash/config/admin-openstackrc.sh'], 'message': 'Fix openrc on zsh

Our openrc files rely on the BASH_SOURCE variable to find configuration
files. This works with bash but not with zsh. With this patch, the
file can also be sourced and used with zsh (on the host machine).

Change-Id: Ice133a31de7fcf21fd48d425f331e6cfac3fbe0c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix openrc on zsh

Our openrc files rely on the BASH_SOURCE variable to find configuration
files. This works with bash but not with zsh. With this patch, the
file can also be sourced and used with zsh (on the host machine).

Change-Id: Ice133a31de7fcf21fd48d425f331e6cfac3fbe0c

subject: Fix use of absolute paths with log_snapshot_split
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 20:05:21.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/tools/log_snapshot_split.py'], 'message': 'Fix use of absolute paths with log_snapshot_split

If absolute paths are passed to log_snapshot_split.py (that is, if the
"ls -l" lines contain absolute paths), then the result files will be
written to these paths which usually means that the original log files
are overwritten.

The script has always been used with relative paths in training-labs,
but any use outside of the project could lead to unexpected outcomes.
To prevent such surprises, this patch makes sure that absolute paths,
too, have the resulting files put into the resultdir supplied by the
user.

In addition, move the creation of result_path down to make the code
easier to understand.

Change-Id: I1a97e827151beb1fb0ce2b8c3308ad0b5b9b5c8c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix use of absolute paths with log_snapshot_split

If absolute paths are passed to log_snapshot_split.py (that is, if the
"ls -l" lines contain absolute paths), then the result files will be
written to these paths which usually means that the original log files
are overwritten.

The script has always been used with relative paths in training-labs,
but any use outside of the project could lead to unexpected outcomes.
To prevent such surprises, this patch makes sure that absolute paths,
too, have the resulting files put into the resultdir supplied by the
user.

In addition, move the creation of result_path down to make the code
easier to understand.

Change-Id: I1a97e827151beb1fb0ce2b8c3308ad0b5b9b5c8c

commit_message:
WIP: Updates Magnum for Mitaka

Previously, Kolla's support of Magnum was not functional. The
Containers may start, but you can not create Magnum bays.

This patch adds support for Magnum Mitaka relase.

Change-Id: Ic07b6c4e1e9cdf67d65f9feadfb20a8752b7fb0f
Related-Bug: 1551992

subject: Make user to group test in test_groups_rbac atomic so it passes.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-14 19:13:14.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/identity/v3/test_groups_rbac.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/identity/v3/rbac_base.py'], 'message': "Make user to group test in test_groups_rbac atomic so it passes.

Currently, test_add_user_group in test_groups_rbac in v3 identity
tests is not implemented correctly, because the API call it performs
implicitly calls _create_test_user, which can cause permissions
errors.

This patch:
  * Refactors test_add_user_group so that it is atomic and thus
    passes.
  * Refactors _create_test_user so that you don't explicitly
    have to pass a user name and set password=None to the
    function.

[0] http://docs.python.org/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I795339db89c3c57cb5d7993fe42d798ba494eb85
Closes-Bug: #1672248
"}]
commit_message:
Make user to group test in test_groups_rbac atomic so it passes.

Currently, test_add_user_group in test_groups_rbac in v3 identity
tests is not implemented correctly, because the API call it performs
implicitly calls _create_test_user, which can cause permissions
errors.

This patch:
  * Refactors test_add_user_group so that it is atomic and thus
    passes.
  * Refactors _create_test_user so that you don't explicitly
    have to pass a user name and set password=None to the
    function.

[0] http://docs.python.org/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I795339db89c3c57cb5d7993fe42d798ba494eb85
Closes-Bug: #1672248

subject: Init policy in pecan after hook as well
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 6951, 'name': 'Brandon Logan', 'email': 'brandon.logan@rackspace.com', 'username': 'brandon-logan'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10184, 'name': 'Nuage CI', 'email': 'nuage-ci@nuagenetworks.net', 'username': 'nuage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 22:48:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/pecan_wsgi/test_hooks.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/hooks/policy_enforcement.py'], 'message': "Init policy in pecan after hook as well

policy.init() is called in the before hook, but this isn't
invoked on GET calls so if the first call a thread receives
is a GET call, we can end up with an uninitialized policy
enforcer and get a traceback.

This just calls policy.init() in the after hook as well.

Change-Id: I29ebc9a91b98a27e707d5b35ad1a24a26e8c8f44
Closes-Bug: #1671267
"}]
commit_message:
Init policy in pecan after hook as well

policy.init() is called in the before hook, but this isn't
invoked on GET calls so if the first call a thread receives
is a GET call, we can end up with an uninitialized policy
enforcer and get a traceback.

This just calls policy.init() in the after hook as well.

Change-Id: I29ebc9a91b98a27e707d5b35ad1a24a26e8c8f44
Closes-Bug: #1671267

commit_message:
qos: Pass correctly table_id to openflow driver

There was a switch to using uninstall_flows() in
I90ff1055d367609694eef975c7d084e4cd7a2cf4. But native driver doesn't
understand 'table' parameter and requires 'table_id' instead.

Closes-bug: #1672789

Change-Id: I7ccbd074c88d7f5577afcc2bba1489bae0897da5

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-09 13:59:25.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "nova: move tripleo-multinode to check -nv

TripleO CI has provided useful feedback to different projects in
OpenStack, including openstackclient, osc-lib, Gnocchi so far.

TripleO CI is able to build packages by using ZUUL_REF of Nova patches,
we think it would be helpful for both Nova and TripleO groups to have
the jobs part of check pipeline, as non-voting for now.

Nova group: to get the feedback at how it works outside devstack. The
job would be non-voting for now, please don't ignore it and report
failures on #tripleo or ping EmilienM on #openstack-nova. If nobody
replies shortly or don't give feedback on the failure, you can ignore
it and move forward in your review process. Though we hope it can be
useful to track some bugs.

TripleO group: we hope to reduce the number of issues we're having when
trying to promote packages in RDO when pulling Nova from trunk, because
the feedback loop is shortened. If someone from Nova group asks for a
failing job, we should provide quick feedback on why (if it's something
on Nova side or TripleO CI infra side).

Change-Id: I199aaba120fea94968b499162fc3bf80c066f999
"}]
commit_message:
nova: move tripleo-multinode to check -nv

TripleO CI has provided useful feedback to different projects in
OpenStack, including openstackclient, osc-lib, Gnocchi so far.

TripleO CI is able to build packages by using ZUUL_REF of Nova patches,
we think it would be helpful for both Nova and TripleO groups to have
the jobs part of check pipeline, as non-voting for now.

Nova group: to get the feedback at how it works outside devstack. The
job would be non-voting for now, please don't ignore it and report
failures on #tripleo or ping EmilienM on #openstack-nova. If nobody
replies shortly or don't give feedback on the failure, you can ignore
it and move forward in your review process. Though we hope it can be
useful to track some bugs.

TripleO group: we hope to reduce the number of issues we're having when
trying to promote packages in RDO when pulling Nova from trunk, because
the feedback loop is shortened. If someone from Nova group asks for a
failing job, we should provide quick feedback on why (if it's something
on Nova side or TripleO CI infra side).

Change-Id: I199aaba120fea94968b499162fc3bf80c066f999

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-07 20:49:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/quota/api.py', 'neutron/quota/resource.py'], 'message': 'Make query in quota api lockless

As one of query to fetch quota usage by resource and tenant
was done in lock mode earlier. This was done to protect the
dirty bit in the usage which tracks for update. For moving to
OVO carrying lock mode can be avoided by making sure that dirty
attribute of quotausages is still protected.

Change-Id: I0bb9f6fb7be51be590afb527a56e0569e922e98f
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
'}]
commit_message:
Make query in quota api lockless

As one of query to fetch quota usage by resource and tenant
was done in lock mode earlier. This was done to protect the
dirty bit in the usage which tracks for update. For moving to
OVO carrying lock mode can be avoided by making sure that dirty
attribute of quotausages is still protected.

Change-Id: I0bb9f6fb7be51be590afb527a56e0569e922e98f
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

subject: Disable docker-registry by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 14:52:38.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp'], 'message': 'Disable docker-registry by default

The docker-registry package has been replaced by docker-distribution in
centos and is failing the puppet code that expect a docker-registry
service. A proper patch I89e14cc2a27299ce4c191d2a823deb0424693831 was
submitted to stable/newton and stable/ocata but was a bit too invasive
for mitaka.

Simply changing the default not to install docker-registry should make
the gate happy again.

Change-Id: I9f5599889ac3e56ba201b01340f21fc7e4051df5
'}]
commit_message:
Disable docker-registry by default

The docker-registry package has been replaced by docker-distribution in
centos and is failing the puppet code that expect a docker-registry
service. A proper patch I89e14cc2a27299ce4c191d2a823deb0424693831 was
submitted to stable/newton and stable/ocata but was a bit too invasive
for mitaka.

Simply changing the default not to install docker-registry should make
the gate happy again.

Change-Id: I9f5599889ac3e56ba201b01340f21fc7e4051df5

subject: Fix Ubuntu ISO update: update md5 sums
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 15:46:22.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/lib/osbash/lib.ubuntu-16.04-server-i386.sh', 'labs/stacktrain/distros/ubuntu_16_04_server_amd64.py', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/lib.ubuntu-16.04-server-amd64.sh'], 'message': 'Fix Ubuntu ISO update: update md5 sums

The previous changeset "Update Ubuntu ISO 16.04.1 to 16.04.2" with
(Change-Id Ie0b93f7cfc3091d82de13fc56d94cae281f84b8a) did not
update the md5 sums, causing the code to delete and redownload
the ISO image for every basedisk build.

Change-Id: I549f79b5268aeed3ae4717a3d8e964a0f9087178
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Ubuntu ISO update: update md5 sums

The previous changeset "Update Ubuntu ISO 16.04.1 to 16.04.2" with
(Change-Id Ie0b93f7cfc3091d82de13fc56d94cae281f84b8a) did not
update the md5 sums, causing the code to delete and redownload
the ISO image for every basedisk build.

Change-Id: I549f79b5268aeed3ae4717a3d8e964a0f9087178

subject: Allow ELEMENTS_DIR to be configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 15:57:09.000000000', 'files': ['bin/dib-lint'], 'message': "Allow ELEMENTS_DIR to be configurable

Prior to version 2.0.0 of diskimage-builder, the elements dir was hard
coded as 'elements' in dib-lint which allowed dib-lint to be consumed by
other projects (instack-undercloud). The 2.0.0 release has changed this
path and it is not overridable so that the other projects can still use
dib-lint. This change makes ELEMENTS_DIR and LIB_DIR check for an
existing environment variable so that dib-lint can be consumed outside
of the diskimage-builder project.

Change-Id: Iae1dade1e20a950e63ffe8dacfea0f23cf9923a0
Related-Bug: #1672730
"}]
commit_message:
Allow ELEMENTS_DIR to be configurable

Prior to version 2.0.0 of diskimage-builder, the elements dir was hard
coded as 'elements' in dib-lint which allowed dib-lint to be consumed by
other projects (instack-undercloud). The 2.0.0 release has changed this
path and it is not overridable so that the other projects can still use
dib-lint. This change makes ELEMENTS_DIR and LIB_DIR check for an
existing environment variable so that dib-lint can be consumed outside
of the diskimage-builder project.

Change-Id: Iae1dade1e20a950e63ffe8dacfea0f23cf9923a0
Related-Bug: #1672730

subject: Add mkfs.vfat to nova-compute source images
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-12 19:31:34.000000000', 'files': ['docker/nova/nova-compute/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Add mkfs.vfat to nova-compute source images

Currently Windows and non-declared os_type images (defaults
to Windows) attempt to format ephemeral volumes with
mkfs.vfat but fail as this tool is not available in the
container.

This is resolved by installing dosfstools on the Source
builds (as I believe this is handled in binary builds
through dependencies).

Change-Id: Iefa5fb0a16eed30aea935268f2a9becb1481b018
Closes-bug: #1672199
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add mkfs.vfat to nova-compute source images

Currently Windows and non-declared os_type images (defaults
to Windows) attempt to format ephemeral volumes with
mkfs.vfat but fail as this tool is not available in the
container.

This is resolved by installing dosfstools on the Source
builds (as I believe this is handled in binary builds
through dependencies).

Change-Id: Iefa5fb0a16eed30aea935268f2a9becb1481b018
Closes-bug: #1672199
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>

subject: Decrement quota usage when deleting an instance in cell0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 22:49:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1670627.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Decrement quota usage when deleting an instance in cell0

When we fail to schedule an instance, e.g. there are no hosts
available, conductor creates the instance in the cell0 database
and deletes the build request. At this point quota usage
has been incremented in the main 'nova' database.

When the instance is deleted, the build request is already gone
so _delete_while_booting returns False and we lookup the instance
in cell0 and delete it from there, but that flow wasn't decrementing
quota usage like _delete_while_booting was.

This change adds the same quota usage decrement handling that
_delete_while_booting performs.

NOTE(mriedem): This change also pulls in some things from
I7de87dce216835729283bca69f0eff59a679b624 which is not being
backported to Ocata since in Pike it solves a slightly different
part of this quota usage issue. In Pike the cell mapping db_connection
is actually stored on the context object when we get the instance
from nova.compute.api.API.get(). So the fix in Pike is slightly
different from Ocata. However, what we need to pull from that Pike
change is:

1. We need to target the cell that the instance lives in to get the
   flavor information when creating the quota reservation.

2. We need to change the functional regression test to assert that
   the bug is fixed.

The code and tests are adjusted to be a sort of mix between both
changes in Pike without requiring a full backport of the 2nd
part of the fix in Pike.

Change-Id: I4cb0169ce0de537804ab9129bc671d75ce5f7953
Partial-Bug: #1670627
(cherry picked from commit 018068c4caac324643c7c6a4360fad855dd096eb)
"}]
commit_message:
Decrement quota usage when deleting an instance in cell0

When we fail to schedule an instance, e.g. there are no hosts
available, conductor creates the instance in the cell0 database
and deletes the build request. At this point quota usage
has been incremented in the main 'nova' database.

When the instance is deleted, the build request is already gone
so _delete_while_booting returns False and we lookup the instance
in cell0 and delete it from there, but that flow wasn't decrementing
quota usage like _delete_while_booting was.

This change adds the same quota usage decrement handling that
_delete_while_booting performs.

NOTE(mriedem): This change also pulls in some things from
I7de87dce216835729283bca69f0eff59a679b624 which is not being
backported to Ocata since in Pike it solves a slightly different
part of this quota usage issue. In Pike the cell mapping db_connection
is actually stored on the context object when we get the instance
from nova.compute.api.API.get(). So the fix in Pike is slightly
different from Ocata. However, what we need to pull from that Pike
change is:

1. We need to target the cell that the instance lives in to get the
   flavor information when creating the quota reservation.

2. We need to change the functional regression test to assert that
   the bug is fixed.

The code and tests are adjusted to be a sort of mix between both
changes in Pike without requiring a full backport of the 2nd
part of the fix in Pike.

Change-Id: I4cb0169ce0de537804ab9129bc671d75ce5f7953
Partial-Bug: #1670627
(cherry picked from commit 018068c4caac324643c7c6a4360fad855dd096eb)

This is the recreate scenario. Patches that are proposed to
fix the bug will build on top of this and change it's assertions

commit_message:
Switch to use stable data_utils

Tempest provides stable library interfaces under tempest.lib.
This patch switches to use it for data_utils.

NOTE: Maybe reviewers will feel deja-vu because the similar patch is
      merged before. But ater that, the another copying tempest patch
      has been merged and we need this patch again. Sorry for this mess.
      Iba05bc604f447f2acaf4cd81e05443b366b821a1 will be merged after
      all projects are ready.

Change-Id: I191fc58418ad4e44dc06da062e2a00566d5140d4

commit_message:
Deprecate glance APIs version config options

Glance v1 APIs are deprecated and v2 are current.
Tempest should tests only v2 APIs and by default v1
APIs are being disabled - I7f962a07317cdad917ee896d79e49ee18938d074

This commit deprecate the API version selection config options
so that we can switch to v2 only testing soon.

Change-Id: I6c4b92f0f2da2797efbb27e16061e6e325dda504

commit_message:
Do not 'enable_plugin networking-generic-switch' in grenade

We don't want to 'enable_plugin networking-generic-switch' in grenade as
it won't work for multi-node jobs.

commit_message:
Fixes test_images_member_rbac missing os credentials for image v2.

Currently Patrole test in image.v2.test_images_member_rbac fails
because of an AttributeError [0], related to the attribute 'os'
missing, meaning that the credentials array lacks the 'primary'
user. This patch adds the 'primary' user to the credentials
array for this test.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/94/444994/4/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-admin-ubuntu-xenial-nv/370bc2d/console.html

Change-Id: I62050cc8595acb87b49ecb9e9c6ff80503591bc3
Partial-Bug: #1670553
