subject: Decrease overall run time when identity auth is set to v3.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-13 21:17:32.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_utils.py', 'contrib/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': 'Decrease overall run time when identity auth is set to v3.

This patch avoids executing time.sleep(1) in rbac_utils, when
Keystone v3 auth is enabled, which greatly reduces run time
(approximately by 5 min or more). Thus, this patch also changes
post_test_hook to forcibly set Keystone v3 auth in the tempest
gates, so that tests run much faster.

Currently time.sleep(1) is used to avoid rounding issues with the
"created_at" field when creating a token. This field drops the
milliseconds from the time field. Attempting to use a token before
the time in the "created_at" field results in an error, meaning that
it is necessary to do time.sleep(1). However, with Keystone v3 this
is not the case, so this time.sleep(1) can be avoided with v3, resulting
in much faster overall test execution time.

Change-Id: I679f75b54bcc61f688f761a6e6f16d4cf0173cb7
'}]
commit_message:
Decrease overall run time when identity auth is set to v3.

This patch avoids executing time.sleep(1) in rbac_utils, when
Keystone v3 auth is enabled, which greatly reduces run time
(approximately by 5 min or more). Thus, this patch also changes
post_test_hook to forcibly set Keystone v3 auth in the tempest
gates, so that tests run much faster.

Currently time.sleep(1) is used to avoid rounding issues with the
"created_at" field when creating a token. This field drops the
milliseconds from the time field. Attempting to use a token before
the time in the "created_at" field results in an error, meaning that
it is necessary to do time.sleep(1). However, with Keystone v3 this
is not the case, so this time.sleep(1) can be avoided with v3, resulting
in much faster overall test execution time.

Change-Id: I679f75b54bcc61f688f761a6e6f16d4cf0173cb7

commit_message:
Add port property: trunk_details

Since the introduction of the neutron trunk port feature in newton some
ports (ie. the trunk parent ports) have a new attribute: trunk_details.
Let the openstack sdk know about it.

See also: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/ \
    ?expanded=show-trunk-details-detail

Change-Id: I7a675f4a1cbd040102174123c354ec4b6a40fad1
Closes-Bug: #1672724

commit_message:
[WIP] Make CentOS run_tests.sh more reliable

When running ./run_tests.sh on CentOS, you have small issues all
the way. It's painful and prevents ppl from properly test the roles
separately.

This should fix small issues that are frequently met.

commit_message:

This was used in bagpipe-bgp to specific a logging
*configuration* rather than a log file, but does not
play well at all with oslo.log habits.

subject: Switch to admin role during client set up to fix some gate bugs.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 15:57:10.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/orchestration/rbac_base.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/identity/v2/rbac_base.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/network/rbac_base.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/volume/rbac_base.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/compute/rbac_base.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/identity/v3/rbac_base.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/image/rbac_base.py'], 'message': 'Switch to admin role during client set up to fix some gate bugs.

The current framework only adds the admin role to
the cls.os.<client-name> namespace when switchToRbacRole=False
is executed; meaning that the first test that is executed
in a test run will not have the admin role during set up.

Thus, it is necessary to add a switch_role with
switchToRbacRole=False to setup_clients (after rbac_utils
is instantiated), so that class-level resources are set
up with admin credentials. This is why
test_flavor_extra_specs_rbac is currently failing [0].
(setup_clients is called before resource_setup.)

This patch:
  * Performs switchToRbacRole=False in the setup_clients
    of every base Patrole test class.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/94/444994/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-admin-ubuntu-xenial-nv/a00e22a/console.html

Change-Id: I8027938daa4fdfff0ac5336324aa6d647322237b
Partial-Bug: #1670553
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to admin role during client set up to fix some gate bugs.

The current framework only adds the admin role to
the cls.os.<client-name> namespace when switchToRbacRole=False
is executed; meaning that the first test that is executed
in a test run will not have the admin role during set up.

Thus, it is necessary to add a switch_role with
switchToRbacRole=False to setup_clients (after rbac_utils
is instantiated), so that class-level resources are set
up with admin credentials. This is why
test_flavor_extra_specs_rbac is currently failing [0].
(setup_clients is called before resource_setup.)

This patch:
  * Performs switchToRbacRole=False in the setup_clients
    of every base Patrole test class.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/94/444994/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-admin-ubuntu-xenial-nv/a00e22a/console.html

Change-Id: I8027938daa4fdfff0ac5336324aa6d647322237b
Partial-Bug: #1670553

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 18:03:28.000000000', 'files': ['vars_plugins/override_folder.py'], 'message': 'Fix the pep8 fixing

First patchset for the override_folder worked functionally but
failed at pep8. I fixed the pep8 and broke the functionality at
the same time.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I40542695c72e5be7799422f265f00c0b6d68ef0e

commit_message:
Fix the pep8 fixing

First patchset for the override_folder worked functionally but
failed at pep8. I fixed the pep8 and broke the functionality at
the same time.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I40542695c72e5be7799422f265f00c0b6d68ef0e

subject: tripleo: implement experimental scenario006
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-21 20:37:42.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'tripleo: implement experimental scenario006

TripleO CI wants to test OpenStack with Ceph replication managed by
puppet-ceph. Therefore, we would like a job that will deploy a 2-nodes
overcloud, where Ceph is configured to replicate objects.

This job would be experimental at first, and only run on Pike (current
master) and beyond; and only when we try to patch ceph files in TripleO.

Change-Id: I5384f64e39b8cca982afa2cc5733964b03fb453f
'}]
commit_message:
tripleo: implement experimental scenario006

TripleO CI wants to test OpenStack with Ceph replication managed by
puppet-ceph. Therefore, we would like a job that will deploy a 2-nodes
overcloud, where Ceph is configured to replicate objects.

This job would be experimental at first, and only run on Pike (current
master) and beyond; and only when we try to patch ceph files in TripleO.

Change-Id: I5384f64e39b8cca982afa2cc5733964b03fb453f

commit_message:
Switch tests to use latest etcd - 3.1.3

Let's move on to newer releases of etcd. Especially since
3.1.x introduced some backwards incompatible changes

https://github.com/coreos/etcd/releases

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 17:52:36.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/debootstrap-minimal/root.d/08-debootstrap', 'diskimage_builder/elements/debootstrap/README.rst', 'diskimage_builder/elements/debootstrap-minimal/README.rst', 'diskimage_builder/elements/debootstrap/element-deps'], 'message': 'Split debootstrap into debootstrap-minimal

Break out the usage of debootstrap into its own minimal element. This
allows users who want to create even more minimal footprints; built
just atop of packages that debootstrap installs.

Change-Id: Id68ac0e148bbce01de6cc9d9df9b3267bd8b9ceb
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Split debootstrap into debootstrap-minimal

Break out the usage of debootstrap into its own minimal element. This
allows users who want to create even more minimal footprints; built
just atop of packages that debootstrap installs.

Change-Id: Id68ac0e148bbce01de6cc9d9df9b3267bd8b9ceb
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Adding OpenStack templates for nova & neutron

Adding nova & neutron templates to the new repo
after it has been decided in the last cycle to keep
the templates and payloads independent of the main
repo in order to package syntribos.

Change-Id: I0d237cc2f216616efae065e2e3c3d972b348e72c

commit_message:
Adding OpenStack templates to the new repo

Adding Cinder, Swift, Glance, Keystone and Solum templates
to the new repo, since it has been decided to keep the templates and
payloads independent of the main repo in order to package syntribos
during last cycle.

Change-Id: I21a4a1c17f773731d2262e7597bea94a87065597

commit_message:
Revert "Docs: Add the remote tag to the badge image"

This reverts commit 63746daa93694dc6a11666d7b0539fe9c3422981.

The faulty docutils version was banned (thanks to global-requirements).
The ':remote:' tag broke our badge image, see [1], so remove the
':remote:' tag.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/README.rst

Change-Id: I484d0ba00ad24936b5a9bf17a0c8942150754878

Due to the high memory footprint of current Python ns-metadata-proxy,
it has to be replaced with a lighter process to avoid OOM conditions in
large environments.

This patch spawns haproxy through a process monitor using a pidfile.
This allows tracking the process and respawn it if necessary as it was
done before. Also, it implements an upgrade path which consists of
detecting any running Python instance of ns-metadata-proxy and
replacing them by haproxy. Therefore, upgrades will take place by
simply restarting neutron-l3-agent and neutron-dhcp-agent.

According to /proc/<pid>/smaps, memory footprint goes down from ~50MB
to ~1.5MB.

Also, haproxy is added to bindep in order to ensure that it's installed.

UpgradeImpact

Depends-On: I36a5531cacc21c0d4bb7f20d4bec6da65d04c262
Depends-On: Ia37368a7ff38ea48c683a7bad76f87697e194b04

Closes-Bug: #1524916
Change-Id: I5a75cc582dca48defafb440207d10e2f7b4f218b
"}]
commit_message:
Switch ns-metadata-proxy to haproxy

Due to the high memory footprint of current Python ns-metadata-proxy,
it has to be replaced with a lighter process to avoid OOM conditions in
large environments.

This patch spawns haproxy through a process monitor using a pidfile.
This allows tracking the process and respawn it if necessary as it was
done before. Also, it implements an upgrade path which consists of
detecting any running Python instance of ns-metadata-proxy and
replacing them by haproxy. Therefore, upgrades will take place by
simply restarting neutron-l3-agent and neutron-dhcp-agent.

According to /proc/<pid>/smaps, memory footprint goes down from ~50MB
to ~1.5MB.

Also, haproxy is added to bindep in order to ensure that it's installed.

UpgradeImpact

Depends-On: I36a5531cacc21c0d4bb7f20d4bec6da65d04c262
Depends-On: Ia37368a7ff38ea48c683a7bad76f87697e194b04

Closes-Bug: #1524916
Change-Id: I5a75cc582dca48defafb440207d10e2f7b4f218b

commit_message:
Copy new l3 and dhcp rootwrap filters for Pike

On upgrading from Ocata, l3 and dhcp filters need an upgrade since
Neutron will be now using haproxy for serving metadata. See [1] for
more details.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/431691/

Partial-bug: #1524916
Change-Id: Ia37368a7ff38ea48c683a7bad76f87697e194b04

As per the discussion at the ATL PTG, deprecate (no plans for removal)
of the V3 Policy Rest API. This is deprecated and not in use anywhere
with the direction of OpenStack to going towards policy-in-code.

This change moves enforcement out of keystone.policy API and into
keystone.common.policy_enforcement and by-default disables access

Change-Id: I2b0f6a5768a4f92446b75024735eef3204b9bd8e

commit_message:
Deprecate and disable (block access) to policy REST API

As per the discussion at the ATL PTG, deprecate (no plans for removal)
of the V3 Policy Rest API. This is deprecated and not in use anywhere
with the direction of OpenStack to going towards policy-in-code.

This change moves enforcement out of keystone.policy API and into
keystone.common.policy_enforcement and by-default disables access
(always returning HTTP 403) to the public RESTful API. The
RESTful API is not slated for removal.

Change-Id: I2b0f6a5768a4f92446b75024735eef3204b9bd8e

subject: Introduce userspace group_vars and host_vars
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-14 11:24:51.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/openstack-ansible.rc'], 'message': 'Introduce userspace group_vars and host_vars

This opens the door to using group_vars and host_vars in
userspace, by allowing the user to define a ":" delimited list
of folder that will then be used by a vars_plugin, and (maybe
later) by the inventory.

This can't override group_vars due to ansible precedence.
We could technically have this override done by moving the
group_vars into a different folder and adding it to these
environment variables.

Change-Id: Ib2cbb35c0a7bccd896fbe71c22eeb07188db99ee
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce userspace group_vars and host_vars

This opens the door to using group_vars and host_vars in
userspace, by allowing the user to define a ":" delimited list
of folder that will then be used by a vars_plugin, and (maybe
later) by the inventory.

This can't override group_vars due to ansible precedence.
We could technically have this override done by moving the
group_vars into a different folder and adding it to these
environment variables.

Change-Id: Ib2cbb35c0a7bccd896fbe71c22eeb07188db99ee

commit_message:
Introduce userspace group_vars and host_vars

This opens the door to using group_vars and host_vars in
userspace, by allowing the user to define a ":" delimited list
of folder that will then be used by a vars_plugin, and (maybe
later) by the inventory.

This can't override group_vars due to ansible precedence.
We could technically have this override done by moving the
group_vars into a different folder and adding it to these
environment variables.

Change-Id: Id22e82b01b08885a1c7b516818ca07e75f6d558f

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-03-13 18:42:19.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Change TripleO multinode jobs to be quickstart based

We are gradually transitioning the way we run CI in TripleO. We
are now ready to move the multinode jobs to be run via
tripleo-quickstart. This changes the multinode gate and check jobs
run in the check-tripleo-jobs group to be run via quickstart.

Since these jobs will now be in the merge queue for other TripleO
projects they are made voting on tripleo-quickstart/extras as well.

The job types are also changed to reflect the new way we are
parsing them. Eventually we will also change job names to be in
line with these new job types, but we want to start with job names
similar to the current ones in order to cause less confusion.

Change-Id: I8208a4982432dbf8f6bd69d895480bf1baf0ea41
'}]
commit_message:
Change TripleO multinode jobs to be quickstart based

We are gradually transitioning the way we run CI in TripleO. We
are now ready to move the multinode jobs to be run via
tripleo-quickstart. This changes the multinode gate and check jobs
run in the check-tripleo-jobs group to be run via quickstart.

Since these jobs will now be in the merge queue for other TripleO
projects they are made voting on tripleo-quickstart/extras as well.

The job types are also changed to reflect the new way we are
parsing them. Eventually we will also change job names to be in
line with these new job types, but we want to start with job names
similar to the current ones in order to cause less confusion.

Change-Id: I8208a4982432dbf8f6bd69d895480bf1baf0ea41

commit_message:
Enable signature verification via environment variable

This change adds a simple change to devstack's
configuration process for Nova so that testers can
easily enable signature verification for Glance images.
This change supports the development of a Tempest
scenario for testing image signature verification.

Blueprint: image-signing-experimental-gate

Change-Id: Idd490b11d5c5ebd89ae51867e3c08f3d1609dd5b

commit_message:
Rename vars/common.yml to vars/main.yml

The file vars/main.yml is automatically loaded
so by using this file name we're able to get
rid of the task that loads vars/common.yml which
is a small optimisation.

Change-Id: I4e32c8e10414080a5c0bd14df874a28b8f28e9fa

commit_message:
Removal of re-switching of rbac-role from tearDown

Currenlty, for every test case class we need to add re-switching of
rbac role in tearDown method.
Thus for every testcase class writing tearDown method becomes mandatory.

This patch removes tearDown dependency for re-switching rbac-role.

Change-Id: Icab26ea8b985bbe54153d42c8df3108fedafb5e5
Implements: blueprint refactor-teardown-switch-roles

subject: Ironic inventory source duplicates MACs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 09:45:24.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'bifrost/inventory.py', 'bifrost/tests/unit/test_inventory.py'], 'message': "Ironic inventory source duplicates MACs

When using the 'ironic' Bifrost inventory source to obtain an Ansible
inventory from ironic, if any nodes have multiple ports then the
resulting inventory contains a 'nics' list variable where each item has
the same MAC address.

This change fixes this issue by reinitialising each new_nic variable
such that all items in the nics list do not reference the same dict.
We also introduce a couple of unit tests for the ironic inventory
source - one to test the simple case of a single node with a single NIC,
another to test the broken case of a single node with multiple NICS.

Change-Id: I173fbbdbebafc05536a153dcf59e4b2f37aebdbc
Closes-Bug: #1671014
"}]
commit_message:
Ironic inventory source duplicates MACs

When using the 'ironic' Bifrost inventory source to obtain an Ansible
inventory from ironic, if any nodes have multiple ports then the
resulting inventory contains a 'nics' list variable where each item has
the same MAC address.

This change fixes this issue by reinitialising each new_nic variable
such that all items in the nics list do not reference the same dict.
We also introduce a couple of unit tests for the ironic inventory
source - one to test the simple case of a single node with a single NIC,
another to test the broken case of a single node with multiple NICS.

Change-Id: I173fbbdbebafc05536a153dcf59e4b2f37aebdbc
Closes-Bug: #1671014

When changing the repo URL, the metadata does not reliably
update, resulting in the right URL being used, but the
wrong package list. This is why we force the metadata to be
cleaned out whenever the repo config changes.

Change-Id: I9bca9a89b58cd539dd5c224d6b141dc4d844bcc2
'}]
commit_message:
Force clean yum metadata when repo config changes

When changing the repo URL, the metadata does not reliably
update, resulting in the right URL being used, but the
wrong package list. This is why we force the metadata to be
cleaned out whenever the repo config changes.

Change-Id: I9bca9a89b58cd539dd5c224d6b141dc4d844bcc2

subject: Set OVS inactivity_probe to vsctl_timeout when adding manager
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 21:49:17.000000000', 'files': ['ovsdbapp/native/helpers.py'], 'message': 'Set OVS inactivity_probe to vsctl_timeout when adding manager

If the vsctl_timeout > OVS's inactivity probe interval and a
transaction execution time exceeds the probe interval, OVS will
disconnect and the transaction will return TRY_AGAIN and most
likely repeat failing until the vsctl_timeout is reached. This
change ensures that the "failsafe" creation of the manager also
sets the inactivity probe to the vsctl_timeout value.

Currently the patch doesn't override the probe_interval on an
existing Manager since it is possible that connection is used by
outside applications and it theoretically should be handled at
deployment.

Related-Bug: #1627106
Change-Id: I76fa0a0cf04a166edf062086fceb2fd90960ad6b
'}]
commit_message:
Set OVS inactivity_probe to vsctl_timeout when adding manager

If the vsctl_timeout > OVS's inactivity probe interval and a
transaction execution time exceeds the probe interval, OVS will
disconnect and the transaction will return TRY_AGAIN and most
likely repeat failing until the vsctl_timeout is reached. This
change ensures that the "failsafe" creation of the manager also
sets the inactivity probe to the vsctl_timeout value.

Currently the patch doesn't override the probe_interval on an
existing Manager since it is possible that connection is used by
outside applications and it theoretically should be handled at
deployment.

Related-Bug: #1627106
Change-Id: I76fa0a0cf04a166edf062086fceb2fd90960ad6b

commit_message:
have list-changes handle missing branch list

If list-changes can't get the branch list, avoid dying from an
IndexError and just treat it as though we expect the release to be on
the specified branch.

Change-Id: I4983b535379353d96aeaeaa52bb883f8ebca400c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Run 'enable_plugin' in project-config for grenade jobs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 14525, 'name': 'Vasyl Saienko', 'email': 'vsaienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vsaienko'}, {'_account_id': 14760, 'name': 'John L. Villalovos', 'email': 'openstack.org@sodarock.com', 'username': 'jlvillal'}, {'_account_id': 22226, 'name': 'Varun Gadiraju', 'email': 'varun.gadiraju@intel.com', 'username': 'gadirajv'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-14 05:40:24.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml'], 'message': "Run 'enable_plugin' in project-config for grenade jobs

IRONIC_DISABLE_DEVSTACK_PLUGIN was added some time back to grenade jobs
in project-config to disable devstack plugin because the grenade code in
Ironic already enabled it.

Unfortunately, subnode local_conf doesn't get updated when
'enable_plugin' is in the grenade settings file. We need to move
enablement of devstack plugin back to project-config to fix this issue,
which is accomplished by this patch.

To prevent the gate from breaking due to devstack plugin being enabled
twice, a change was made to devstack/upgrade/settings that
performs a check to see if the ironic devstack plugin has already been
enabled and does the following:
  * If it has already been enabled it will not enable it again.
  * If it has not yet been enabled it will enable it.

This change was made to master, stable/ocata, and stable/newton branches.
All changes have landed.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/444335/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/444944/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/444950/

Once this patch merges, we will propose a follow-up patch to
devstack/upgrade/settings that removes all the additonal logic and
enabling of the ironic devstack plugin.

Change-Id: Idb9c556e7d2553c9f13e07077676fd7505bfb19c
"}]
commit_message:
Run 'enable_plugin' in project-config for grenade jobs

IRONIC_DISABLE_DEVSTACK_PLUGIN was added some time back to grenade jobs
in project-config to disable devstack plugin because the grenade code in
Ironic already enabled it.

Unfortunately, subnode local_conf doesn't get updated when
'enable_plugin' is in the grenade settings file. We need to move
enablement of devstack plugin back to project-config to fix this issue,
which is accomplished by this patch.

To prevent the gate from breaking due to devstack plugin being enabled
twice, a change was made to devstack/upgrade/settings that
performs a check to see if the ironic devstack plugin has already been
enabled and does the following:
  * If it has already been enabled it will not enable it again.
  * If it has not yet been enabled it will enable it.

This change was made to master, stable/ocata, and stable/newton branches.
All changes have landed.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/444335/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/444944/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/444950/

Once this patch merges, we will propose a follow-up patch to
devstack/upgrade/settings that removes all the additonal logic and
enabling of the ironic devstack plugin.

Change-Id: Idb9c556e7d2553c9f13e07077676fd7505bfb19c

commit_message:
Add cpu_mode in quickstart guide

With libvirt 2.0, when using qemu cpu mode is not properly
evaluated and need to be set to cpu_mode = none.

Add this option when kvm is not supported, otherwise user
will still facing errors when launching instances over qemu.

Change-Id: Ic970e3de74817ce4e17bb4e15d130e1e82d595cc
